loans.name: Jose Buenerje

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador que a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente, actividad que le permite salir adelante junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad a los que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante y apoyarlos en sus estudios. José desea construir un muro de retención, ya que como se observa en la fotografía, la vivienda, corre el riesgo de caer, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para construir un muro de contención proteger su hogar de una tragedia.
texts.en:
José is a hard-working man who at 47 years of age works offering his services as an independent bricklayer. This business allows him to get ahead together with his life companion and his three children aged 16, 14 and 11 years old. He is always looking for ways to get ahead and help them with their studies.

José wants to construct a retaining wall. As you can observe in the photo the house is at risk of falling. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to construct a retaining wall to protect his house from a tragedy.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to construct a retaining wall and protect his house from disaster.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a resident in the town of Dumanjug. She is a 35-year-old married woman and has two kids. She earns a living by raising and selling livestock like goats, cows and pigs. She sells them to the locals and town settlers in her place. This is her main source of income. Her husband is a driver.

She would like to improve her livelihood. At this time, she has no funds to purchase another livestock to gain higher yield.

Joan has joined CEVI to avail herself of a loan and wants to purchase a pig. In that way, she will be able to slowly manage her finances and settle her obligation. She will thus be able to save and continue to expand, and to become more sustainable.

She is determined that someday she will become productive in her chosen field to be able to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. Two of her children are in school.

She explains that she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Perla has an electronic shop business in the Philippines. Perla has been in this business for 3 years.

Perla is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials, such as tools, for her shop. In the future, Perla would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as tools, for her shop.

loans.name: Lobar

texts.ru: Лобар благодарит за предыдущий кредит. Она смогла вовремя оплатить учебный год дочки. Лобар старается создать дочки все условия для получения образование. Теперь она просит помочь ей купить учебники для дочки и учебные материалы для младшего сына, чтобы он смотрел на сестру и тоже хорошо стал учиться и подтягивать свою успеваемость.
texts.en: Lobar is grateful for her previous loan. She was able to pay her daughter's tuition on time. Lobar does all she can to enable her daughter to receive a good education. At present she is asking for help with buying textbooks for her daughter and educational materials for her younger son so that he would  following his sister's example, improve his grades and become a good student as well.

loans.use: to buy textbooks for children.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат уроженка района А.Чоми. Она 1974 года рождения. Саодат жена и мать. Она занимается животноводством около 10 лет. Саодат  занимается этим бизнесом, чтобы принести в дом доход, и ее доход многозначителен для семейного бюджета. Саодат будет использовать кредит на покупку телят и корма для них. Также корм для скотин с запасом на зиму.
texts.en: Saodat was born in 1974 in the A. Jomi district of Tajikistan.  She is a wife and mother.  She has been raising livestock for about 10 years now.  She is involved in this business because it allows her to bring an income home. Her earnings make a big difference in the family budget.  She will use her loan to buy a few calves and some feed for them.  She will also buy fodder for her other livestock, in order to have enough for the winter.

loans.use: to buy a few calves and some animal feed.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: В городе Турсунзаде живут и творят талантливые рукодельницы и мастерицы - вышивальщицы. Одна из таких мастериц Нилуфар, которая занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды и других национальных изделий. Этому красивому ремеслу Нилуфар научилась после замужества. Ей учительницей была ее свекровь. По ее словам сегодня шитье стало ее любимой делом. Нилуфар хочет приобрести профессиональную швейную машинку. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность. В будущем Нилуфар желает передать  свои навыки и мастерство своим дочерям и невесткам.
texts.en: Many talented needlewomen and embroiderers live and work in the city of Tursunzoda.  One of these skilled women is Nilufar.  Nilufar sews traditional Tajik dresses for women as well as other regional items.  She learned this beautiful craft from her mother-in-law, after she got married.  According to Nilufar, sewing is now her favorite occupation.  She now wants to buy a professional sewing machine.  Thanks to the loan that she has requested, she will be able to expand her activity.  In the future, she would like to transmit her skills and expertise to her daughters and daughters-in-law.

loans.use: to buy a professional sewing machine.

loans.name: Butanuka Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe  Butanuka et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 34 ans et est marié.Il a une famille de 4 enfants  âgés de 7 mois à 10ans dont 1 étudie. 

Il fait  le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  pratiquer  l’élevage  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Butanuka group and he lives in Bubanza.  He is 34 years old, married, and the father of four children between the ages of 10 years old and 7 months.  One of his children goes to school.

Elie has been selling palm oil for the past five years.  This is his fourth loan with Turame.  With this current loan, financed by Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale.  His goal is to increase his income.

In the coming years, Elie would like to start raising cattle and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of palm oil and increase his income.

loans.name: Geoconda Nereysi

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Al Poder se reúne cada quince días en Cascol el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Geoconda tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos estudian en universidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Geoconda es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida, desde hace mas de 4  años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de la marca Leonisa, además de  productos de Yanbal y Onilife (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta ella sale tres o cuatro veces por semana ya sea para vender o para cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días,  tiene muy buena clientela que ha logrado en estos 15 años que lleva realizando esta labor.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, entre otros. Lleva 10 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Al Poder" communal bank meets every fortnight in Cascol in Pajan Canton. This canton is known as the livestock area of the province. One of its’ attractions is the Montubio rodeos that are organized at different times during the year. 
 
Geocanda lives in this place. She is 53-years old and married. From this relationship, she has four adult children, two of them are studying at university. Her husband is a driver.
 
Geocanda is a woman who has always liked to work to earn her living. For more than four years, she has been making a living selling undergarments by the brand Leonisa, as well as products by Yanbal and Onilife (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies).
 
Her way of selling is door to door. She goes out three or four times a week to either sell or collect outstanding credit. She gets paid every 8 days. She has a very good clientele that she has managed to gain in the 15 years she has carried out this job.
 
She is going to use the loan to buy undergarments,  shoes, creams, perfumes, among other things. She has been in the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Les Vaillants Group

texts.fr: Kikundi est une femme d’affaires, qui commerce les ustensiles de cuisines dans un magasin de la ville depuis 5 ans, conseillère du groupe solidaire «Les Vaillants», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 26 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 1 est encore bébé. Elle va s’approvisionner  en assiettes, casseroles, cuillères et louches, etc. Elle commença son business  avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kikundi is a business woman who has been selling kitchen utensils in a shop in town, for the past five years.  She is a consultant for the solidarity group «Les Vaillants» and a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima.  She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of five children, four of whom go to school while the youngest is still a baby.  She will use her loan to buy plates, saucepans, spoons, ladles etc.  She started her own business with some capital received from her husband.  Her goal is to increase her credit, feed her children and send them to school.  In the end, she thanks Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy plates, saucepans, spoons, ladles etc..

loans.name: Rocio Ximena

texts.es: Roció tiene 35 años de edad, es de estado civil casado, ella es una persona muy responsable en su hogar, su esposo trabaja al jornal, ella solicita el crédito para poder invertir en su pequeña tienda, ya que esto es una fuente de trabajo, porque es la única tienda en su localidad.
texts.en:
Roció is 35 years old and married. She is a very responsible person at home. Her husband works as a laborer.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her small store, as this is a source of work, being the only store in the area.

loans.use: to invest in her small store.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, de 38 años de edad, está soltera, solo estudio hasta octavo grado y vive solo con su mamá.

Martha, tiene una tienda desde hace 3 años y es de ahí de donde obtiene los ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda como; arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan y detergentes, para poder surtir más la tienda.

Martha, sueña con tener una tienda grande para y de esa manera poder seguir dándole una calidad de vida a su madre.
texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and single. She reached only up to the eighth grade in school, and lives with her mother. Martha has had a shop for the past 3 years, and it is from that that she earns the income to meet her needs.

Martha needs a loan to buy more products for her shop, such as rice, beans, sugar, bread and detergent, to better stock the store. 

Martha dreams to have a large store and thus continue giving her mother a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop, such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, and detergent, to better stock the store.

loans.name: Nabonswende Lucienne Group

texts.fr:
Mme LUCIENNE  est la responsable du groupe  NABONSWENDE  LUCIENNE.  Elle se porte bien.   Elle est  mariée,  mère de 06 enfants.  Elle a un enfant de   41 ans et un enfant de  20 ans. Elle a 03 enfants qui  vont  à l’école  et 03 personnes en charges.
Mme fait de l’agriculture. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans le marché  de  son village. Ses clients sont les commerçants.
Avec  l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter  01 sac d’engrais pour  ses cultures. 
 Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter plus d’engrais pour avoir de bonnes cultures.  Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire elle veut agrandir son  champs,  pour la famille elle  veut  payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Lucienne is the representative of the NABONSWENDE  LUCIENNE group.  She is doing well; she is married and the mother of six children.  She has two adult children, now 41 and 20, as well as three children who go to school.  She has three people under her care.

Lucienne has been working as a farmer for five years.  She buys her supplies at the local market in her village and sells her crops to merchants.  She is planning to use her loan to buy one bag of fertilizer for her cultures. 

Lucienne wants to use the profits from her loan to buy more fertilizer and improve her cultures.  Her professional goal is to increase the size of her land.  Her personal goal is to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy one bag of fertilizer for her cultures.

loans.name: Orlando Estaly

texts.es: Orlando es un hombre trabajador de 52 años de edad que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de electricista, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 20 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Él vive junto a sus hijos mayores de edad y su nieto que es su gran alegría. Orlando desea mejorar poco a poco su vivienda, por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y lámina para construir un cuarto en la parte del corredor que se observa en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Orlando is a hardworking man, aged 52, who works as an electrician. He has been an electrician for more than 20 years, which makes makes him happy to  bring an income home.

He lives along with his adult children and his grandson, who is his great joy. 

Orlando would like to improve his home little by little, which is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal sheeting to build a room in the part of the corridor visible in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal sheeting to build a room in the part of his corridor visible in the photograph.

loans.name: Ridwan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ridwan, one of Ruma's agents. Ridwan lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall where he provides mobile airtime credits to his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 because he wanted to learn how to improve his business, as well as to contribute to his community. He feels happy because the sales executive is kind and helpful to him.

As the business grows, Ridwan hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Your loan is important to Ridwan because it will help him improve his business as well as his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Ridwan is the one standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill-payment services.

loans.name: Duterimbere Subgroup C

texts.en: Micheline is the leader of the group Duterimbere, which means “Let's prosper." She is thirty-four years old and married with three children between the ages of four and eleven years. The group members sell different products and they all wish to expand their businesses to make more profit and be able to save for their future. Micheline owns a shop and has been in business for the past ten years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, maize flour, and beans to sell. She will use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, maize flour, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Magnifique Group

texts.fr: Kashama est une femme d’affaires, qui commerce les fretins et autres poissons au domicile dans une avenue animée dans le centre commercial depuis 3 ans, présidente du groupe de crédits «Magnifique», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont 1 étudie, 2 sont grands. Elle va s’approvisionner en 4 sacs de fretins. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kashama is a business woman who sells small fish and other types of fish.  She has been involved in this activity for three years and sells from her house, located along a busy street in the commercial center of town.  She is also the president of the "Magnifique" credit group and a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima.  She is the mother of three children, one of whom is still in school, the other two are grown up now.

Kashama will use her loan to buy four bags of small fish.  She started her own business with some capital received from her husband.  She would like to expand her activity, feed her youngest child, and continue to send him to school.  She thanks Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy four bags of small fish.

loans.name: Ashwaq

texts.en:
Ashwaq is a 42-year-old married mother of three. She works selling clothes from her house to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a wide experience in this domain and has loyal customers.

Ashwaq is trying hard to develop her business.  Therefore today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new items for the upcoming Christmas season. She hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and remain able to provide her beloved children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Victorino Jr.

texts.en: Victorino is a man who is engaged in selling frozen foods for two years to earn a living. He is 30 years old, married, and has four children; ages 10, 4, 3 and 1 year old. He is in need of an amount to help him run his business continuously. He will buy frozen goods such as ham, sweetened meat, and hotdogs. In the future, Victorino is aiming for business to improve to increase their livelihood and so he will be able to give a good education to their children.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods such as ham, sweetened meat, and hotdogs.

loans.name: Ruchie

texts.en:
Ruchie is 42 years old and married with four children.

Ruchie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

Ruchie has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling purified water.

Ruchie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is 29 years old and lives in Gaza with her husband; they have one son and six daughters. She has been working at a poultry farm for five years and her husband works at governmental institution. She is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. Her house was destroyed, and she would like to repair it. She has requested this loan to do maintenance work, rebuild the damaged walls and the ceiling, paint the house, and install electricity, doors, and windows, It will also pay for the worker to start work on the rebuilding. 

Basma is very grateful to everyone who helps her. She hopes to be able to be back to her normal life again with her family and to provide good living conditions for her family. 

The one who appears in the photo is her husband. For cultural reasons she can’t publish her photos online and she apologies.

loans.use: to do maintenance work, rebuild walls and the ceiling, paint the house, and install electricity, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a mother of three children. She earns a living by selling fresh fish to the community of Clarin, Bohol. She works hard together with her husband, a fisherman, to provide and support the needs of their family.

Ursula is a determined woman. In spite of the obstacles that she and her family encountered, she will be able to stand up and continue doing well for her family. With this loan, she is requesting funds for additional capital to buy more fresh fish to sell. It will help her improve her business and make it more profitable for her children’s educational. She wants them all to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old and married with two children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Zenaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Naseem Bibi

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old mother of four children living with her husband in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family, but Naseem has also been engaged in a clothes-selling business for the past 20 years. She earns a limited income to help cover the needs and expenses of her children. Naseem is trying hard to improve their living conditions.

Today Naseem is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to grow her business and provide a better income.

Naseem and her family are thankful to Kiva and its lenders as well as to BRAC Pakistan for funding this loan that will improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in her clothes business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
This is Eunice. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more supplies for her business. She says her family's living standard has also improved since the last loan. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for KES 50,000 to buy more stock of flour, oil, beans, etc. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Catigbian, Bohol, with her family. She is married with five adult children. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) business where she sells a variety of goods. She has been doing this for seven years.

Timotea has become proficient in this business, and she eagerly wants to enhance this livelihood. Her problem is she has a lack of capital to run this business continuously, because her capital is used for other emergency needs such as daily consumption and bills.

With this loan, she needs an amount to buy commodities needed in her store. She will purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, powdered juice and drinks. Thus, Timotea wants in the future to enhance her store business to be able to start other business opportunities that augment her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, powdered juice and drinks

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married mother of three whose husband provides additional income. Shehas been in business for the last one year, doing well.

Anna is 40 years old and a second-hand clothes trader.

This marks her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase bedsheets and clothes for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bedsheets and clothes

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia, 40 years old, is married and has one child. She borrowed a loan to buy more goods for her carenderia business.  Her husband helps her in the business. They also sell at a sari-sari store in the school to enable them to supply their immediate needs. As a parent, she wants to give her child a better future and let her finish school through her business. Her dream is to expand her business and be financially stable in the coming years so that she may be able to help her family as well.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her carenderia business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Elias is 29 years old and married with one kid who is two years old. He lives in the Beit Sahoor neighborhood in Bethlehem city.

Elias started this business five years ago. He has a small shop for olive wood souvenirs that are made by him. It is known that Bethlehem city is famous for this kind of activity because it is a tourist city.

Elias chose this time of the year to request the loan from ACAD because it is the Christmas Holiday period and Bethlehem will be full of tourists. The business faces one main challenge which is the high competition in the local market.

Elias says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his project. In the future Elias plans to buy a laser machine to keep track with the market competition. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new manual wood machines and improve his business.

loans.name: Yi Wa Opio Group

texts.fr: Clémentine, est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisées. Elle vend du poisson au marché et cela fait 27 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter du poissons à 200 000 francs. Elle a un bon emplacement au bord du goudron, ce qui fait marcher son activité en plus de ça elle propose de la bonne qualité de sa marchandise à ses clients. Après ses vente, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle est à leur 3 ème fois de contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et les remboursements ont été faites à la bonne  date prévue
texts.en:
Clémentine is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. She has been selling fish at the market for twenty-seven years.

Clémentine will use her loan to buy fish for 200,000 francs CFA. She sells it from a good position at the side of the road and always offers high quality fish for sale. Her profits will provide for her family, help improve her business and be saved. This is the third loan for this group and the previous repayments have always been made on the planned dates.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Nerwaya Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEBOU  est la responsable du groupe  NERWAYA.  Elle se porte bien. Elle est  mariée,    mère de 04 enfants. Elle  a un enfant  de  18 ans et un enfant de 13 ans. Elle a 04 enfants qui vont à l’école et  04 personnes en charges.
Mme vend des chaussures  depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans le marché de dix de la Côte d’Ivoire.  Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Avec  l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  20 lots de chaussures pour vendre dans  son magasin.  
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner afin d’ouvrir une autre boutique de vende de chaussures.  Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire elle veut agrandir son magasin de vente de chaussures afin d’attirer plus de clients, pour la famille elle veut subvenir aux différents besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djenebou is the representative of the Nerwaya Group. She is doing very well. She is married and mother to four children. She has one child who is eighteen years old and one child who is thirteen years old. In total, she is responsible for four children who all attend school.

Djenebou has been selling shoes for ten years. She buys her stock from the market in Ivory Coast and sells to both men and women. Her loan will buy twenty lots of shoes for sale in her shop. She plans to save her profits so she can open another shoe shop in the future. Her ambition for her business is to expand her shop and attract more customers. Her ambition for her family is to provide for all their needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 lots of shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Thạnh

texts.en:
Ms Thạnh is 46 years old and she is a single parent of two children.

She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years. Thạnh lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her household was recognized by the local government as poor and this region often suffers from natural disasters such as floods and droughts. She has no collateral so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

Her family has a latrine but not a hygienic one. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and other equipment to build a toilet.

This is Thạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Thạnh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and other equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 27 years old, married to Iyphine and blessed with two children.

He is a motorcycle rider and has been in this business for eight years. He earns a monthly income of Kshs. 18,000.

This being his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, he intends to buy a new motorcycle for transport and hopes this will increase his income.

He anticipates purchasing more goats to raise from the expanded business profits.

His dream is to own a matatu for tax and hiring purposes.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Marilyn lives a simple life with her family in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with two children; they are 13 and 10 years old. She sells fish from her husband's catch. Hence, her husband is a fisherman. They have been doing this for 11 years to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their children.

Now Marilyn is asking for a loan as she wants to buy fishing net to help them improve their catch and increase their sales. Her goal in life is to enhance their livelihood to have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 41 years old. He is married to Salome, and they are blessed with 3 children of ages between 13 and 4 years respectively.

He has had a farming business for 20 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 40,000. He has borrowed KES. 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his fifth loan, after paying the previous loan successful. 

He will use the loan to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: This is Reuben a student of Mount Kenya University in his final year. He is 37 years. He has always desired to advance in studies and thus he enrolled for a Bachelor of Education. His desire is to serve the world around him and become a better person. He has been struggling financially to meet his education needs and with a Kiva loan he will be able to complete his Degree.

loans.use: to pay for Tuition and Non-tuition costs. He is a mature student studying for his degree in  Education

loans.name: Sid N Baasde Group

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata  est la responsable du groupe  SID N BAASDE.  Elle se porte bien. Elle est  mariée,  mère de 01 enfant de 14 ans. Aucun  n’enfant ne  va à l’école,  elle a 03 personnes en charges.
Mme vend des marchandises diverses depuis 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans le marché de Toécin. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Avec, l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  08 cartons de marchandises  pour vendre dans  son magasin.  
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter d’autres marchandises. Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire,  agrandir son magasin de vente de marchandises  afin d’attirer plus de clients, pour la famille  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of the 'Sid N Baasde' Group. She is doing very well. She is married and mother to one child who is fourteen years old. Her child does not attend school and Aminata is responsible for a total of three people.

Aminata has been selling various products for two years. She buys her stock from the market in Toécin and sells it to both men and women. Her loan will buy eight boxes of merchandise for sale in her shop. She plans to use her profits to buy further stocks of merchandise. Her ambition for her business is to expand her shop and attract more customers. Her ambition for her family is to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 boxes of merchandise for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en: Patrocinia has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Pagadian City and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Patrocinia knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a businesswoman from Pagadian City. She is 58 years old, widow and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Thelma is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Thelma continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 63 years old. She is a mother of four children. She has had a medical clinic business for 15 years, currently earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

She has borrowed 80,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya for her third loan after paying the previous loans successfully, and she will be using the loan to pay school fees. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have well-established medical services and business so as to enable her to offer the best medical services to the community as a devoted christian medical practitioner and also to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Raheel

texts.en:
Raheel is a married man living with his family in Rawalpindi,Pakistan. His family is into the business of cloth selling which his father started 15 years ago ,and Raheel started working there at very young age.However now Raheel wanted to increase his business by investing a little amount in and from that amount buying the stock which is in most demand these days.

Therefore Raheel applied for the loan so that he get help with his business. And Raheel appreciates the efforts put in by Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in his clothing shop.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase flour, oil, sugar, and other supplies for her retail business. 

With her previous loan, she was able to improve her business, and she aspires to expand her business. Also, she says the loan improved her family's standard of living by schooling her children.

Kibibi is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, sugar, and other supplies for her retail business.

loans.name: Ra Zamb Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme PATINDKOGRE est la responsable du groupe  RA  ZAMB  WENDE.  Elle se porte bien.  Elle est  Mariée,  mère de 05 enfants. Elle a un enfant de  27 ans  et  un  enfant  de 10 ans. Elle a 03 enfants qui  vont à l’école et  03 personnes en charges.
Mme vend du savon et du charbon de bois. Elle pratique cette activité depuis  07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans le marché de Toecin et des villages environnants.  Ses clients sont les habitants de Yagma.
Avec, l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  01 sac de savon cabagourou, 01 carton de savon carré,  20 sacs de charbon de bois  pour vendre avec ses clients.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner et acheter plus de marchandises. Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire, elle veut agrandir son champs d’activité, pour la famille, elle veut subvenir aux besoins ce sa famille.
texts.en:
Patindkogre is the leader of the 'Ra Zamb Wende' Group. She is doing very well. She is married and mother to five children. One of her children is twenty-seven years old and one is ten years old. Three of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of three people.

Patindkogre has been selling soap and charcoal for seven years. She buys her stock from the market in Toecin and the surrounding villages. Her customers live in Yagma. Patindkogre will use her loan to buy one sack of cabagourou soap, one box of block soap and twenty sacks of charcoal for sale to her customers. She will use her profits to buy more stock and increase her savings. Her ambition for her business is to expand the range of products she offers. Her ambition for her family is to provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of cabagourou soap, 1 box of blocks of soap and 20 sacks of charcoal to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

With her previous loan, she was able to improve her business and improve her family's living standard by being able to provide their basic needs like food as compared to before.

Purity is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Irma is the featured borrower of the Love Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back home.

Irma is a 62-year-old widowed mother of four children who traveled to Lebanon and started working as a housemaid to cover the needs and expenses of her family. Today, Irma is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Irma is the first lady standing on the right. Sally is standing in the middle, and Carmela is the first on the left, Josephine is the second lady on the left, and Clarita is the second on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is widowed. She is a very kind and responsible woman. Mohira lives with her family in the south part of Tajikistan. She is a careful mother of six children. Some of them are non-adults. Mohira always tries for the well-being of her children, and she is the only feeder of her children.

Mohira began her business eight years ago with the buying and selling of women clothes because she needed the money. Mohira buys women clothes in bulk and retails in a local market where she has a selling place. Mohira periodically renews the assortment of her goods. Mohira now is going to buy women clothes for the new season. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is in his early 30's, is single. He has been a tailor for 10 years now. He works from 7 am to 8.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Godfrey's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy the sewing equipment and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to repay his loan, to take care of himself and his mother and cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy the sewing products and best materials for making in-style suits and ladies dresses. He dreams of building his own house.

Godfrey will share this loan with his loan group, Parachichi, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the sewing products and best materials for making in-style suits and ladies dresses.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old. She is a single mother blessed with one child. She has had a clothing business for 3 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She has borrowed KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her third loan, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will be using this loan to purchase clothing.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established restaurant service and business, and also to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta thought she was in the right place when she joined Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Gualberta has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she availed a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. Gualberta wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: T. Wahyu

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Wahyu, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his family and his daughter. He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He joined Ruma in 2014. He wanted to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to improve his business, as well as how to give more contribution to his community. He feels happy as well because the sales executive is being kind and helpful to him.

As the business grows, Wahyu is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and, accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. Wahyu is the one who is seen in the photo with his daughter. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Patatousba Group

texts.fr:
Mme SYLVIE  est la responsable du groupe  PATATOUSBA.  Elle se porte bien.  Elle est  Mariée,  mère de 04 enfants.  Elle  a 01 enfant de 17 ans et  01 enfant de 01 an. Elle a 03 enfants qui  vont à l’école et 04 personnes en charges.
Mme vend des fruits.  Elle pratique cette activité depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans le marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Avec, l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  02  cartons de bananes,  et 02 cartons  d’orange  pour vendre avec ses clients.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter d’autres fruits pour vendre.  Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire, elle veut agrandir son activité de vende de fruits, pour la famille, elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de  ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvie is the leader of the Patatousba Group. She is doing very well. She is married and mother to four children. One of her children is seventeen years old and one is one year old. Three of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of four people.

Sylvie has been selling fruit for ten years. She buys her stock from the market in Toecin and sells it to both men and women. Sylvie will use her loan to buy two boxes of bananas and two boxes of oranges for sale to her customers. She will use her profits to buy more fruit to sell. Her ambition for her business is to expand the range of fruit she offers. Her ambition for her family is to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of bananas and 2 boxes of oranges to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a 40-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Gladys has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Gladys described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Gladys’s group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is the group leader of her group in Webuye District, and she is representing six farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Eunice joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Eunice decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to send her children to school. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer that she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Eunice's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 1.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of two solar lights, as, even though Eunice decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.				.

loans.name: Ithanji Muirungi Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is David. He is 27 years old and married. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

He does dairy farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to repair his cow shed and buy dairy feed. This will enable him to get more milk, and hence get increased income, to cater for his family’s basic needs, such as better food and clothing.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair the cow shed and buy dairy feed to help cater for his family's basic needs, such as better food and clothing.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 65 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three adult children. Vivian earns a living from a RTW and cosmetics-dealing business. She is also earning income from their parcel of coconut land.  She’s been in the business for more than 10 years already and earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to help pay for the allowances of her son’s employment application abroad.

Vivian has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Vivian hopes to expand her RTW and cosmetics-dealing business.

loans.use: pay for the allowances of her son’s employment application abroad.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 31 years old. She is married to John, and they are blessed with three children who are respectively between 3 to 11 years old.

She has had a food business for three years, currently earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES. She has borrowed 60,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan after paying the previous loan successfully.

She will be using the loan to purchase kitchen equipment, like new cutlery and crockery as well as cooking pots.  

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen equipment, like new cutlery and crockery as well as cooking pots.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her previous loan has indeed helped develop her business. She faithfully repaid an amount of PHP 30,000, which she had used in buying additional grocery items and other merchandise for her inventory. As a result, her sales and profit increased and that somehow eased their financial difficulty.

This blessing and opportunity from Kiva inspired her to further improve her stocks and sales. She is humbly requesting another PHP 30,000 loan. Again she will use it to purchase cases of soft drinks, grocery items, dried fish, frozen goods, and basic school supplies. Most likely, her customers will be happy to buy from her store with a wide variety of selections.

Soon her youngest child will be graduating from college and she will be relieved of the huge expenses. She can focus more on enhancing her business and her dream of having a little comfort in life is drawing near.

Every Thursday, she consistently meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks, grocery items, dried fish, frozen goods, and basic school supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old. She is married with five children.

She has had a tailoring business for 21 years. She will be using the loan to purchase more materials to make clothes for her customers.

She will use her anticipated profit to improve the condition of her house and to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and to live a happy life.

loans.use: to  purchase more materials to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has always wanted to own a biogas system but didn't know a reliable biogas installer. He learned about Takamoto biogas loans through a neighbour and got interested.

With this loan, he will be able to have smoke-free and convenient fuel for his homestead.

loans.use: to purchase a bio-digester for clean, convenient cooking.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 38 years old and married with 7 children.

She has had a salon business for 20 years, and she will be using this loan to purchase beauty products for her salon.

She will use her anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and also to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her house and to live a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 45-year-old married father of three. He has been working in car body work since 1999. He is well-known in his region with his special talents and skills in his domain, and he is recommended by most of his customers.

He is his family's sole breadwinner and is working hard to develop his family's living and fulfill their dreams.

Salameh needs to make sure that his income covers his family's increasing living needs, and therefore has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. This loan will be invested in paying for his children's school tuition fees.

He is working hard to expand his workplace so he can accept more cars in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Nour El Houda

texts.en:
Nour El Houda is a 21-year-old single lady. Due to the low financial situation of her family, she left school at an early age, and started working five years ago in a clothing shop to cover her needs and expenses.

Nour El Houda's salary is limited, and she has been dreaming of traveling to visit holy places. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to make her dream come true. She hopes to improve her living conditions more in the future.

loans.use: to travel and visit holy places

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. She will use the loan to purchase charcoal to resell.

She used the previous loan to improve her business and her family's living standard. Her aspirations and goals are to keep expanding her business in order to improve her living standards more and more.

Josephine is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Micro-finance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase  charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale.

With her previous loan, she was able to improve her business and her family's living standard as compared to before. She aspires to expand her business.

Teresia is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gita's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Gita. She is a widow and a farmer by profession. She has two daughters and three sons in her care. She has to work very hard in order to feed her children. A humble resident of a village in Panpose, Odisha, India, Gita does not have access to a toilet at her home.

Unavailability of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to isolated fields in the early morning and late at night to relieve herself. Gita feels the risk of being infected by diseases due to this unsanitary practice and she can sense the risk of crimes and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, Gita along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and sanitized toilet at her home. Access to a toilet will enhance Gita's hygiene and she will be able to lead a disease-free, healthy life.

loans.use: to build a clean and sanitized toilet at her home

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is a 28-year-old married woman with three children who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Layal hopes to continue supporting her children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Pisit

texts.en: Pisit is a 21-year-old single student who is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law, and is in his first year at a university in the city. Pisit’s family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for his tuition fees. Because Pisit is short of finances to cover his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. His dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old married mother of three. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided three years ago to start selling clothes and cosmetics to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their children.

Mariam is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her customers. She is trying desperately to develop her business and requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new winter collections for the upcoming Christmas season.

Mariam hopes to expand her business by opening her own shop, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new winter collections for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children.

She has had a poultry farming business for 4 years and will use the loan to purchase 1-day-old chicks to sell as meat. She hopes this will help her to educate her children through University.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her poultry farm.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed 30,000 KSH to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase 1-day-old  chicks.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is the proud owner of a shop that has been selling all types of home products for twenty years. The shop was initially established by her father in law, but Rasha has successfully run the business for four years.

She is Lebanese, 24 years old, and lives in Beirut with her husband who works in water distribution.
She holds a university degree which helps her manage the shop with the needed skills and knowledge.

In order to develop her business, Rasha is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. She needs to buy new products for her shop before the holidays and the Christmas season.

Rasha is well known in the area and her clients see her as an honest, hard working woman who has a very good reputation.

loans.use: to buy new products for her shop

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

With her previous loan, she was able to improve her business and her family's living standard as compared to before.

Peris is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jasi's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the extreme right hand side in the photograph is Jasi. She is a humble resident of a small village in Panpose, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and resides with her husband and two sons. Her husband is the sole earner in her family and works very hard to be capable enough to make both ends meet for the family. The income earned by her husband is very limited for them.

Unfortunately, Jasi does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites and she is vulnerable to crimes.

In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene, Jasi along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet in her house.

Your loan will help Jasi to enjoy a healthy and disease-free life.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet in her house

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a 20-year-old man with 1 child.

He has had a shoes business for 3 years. He will be using the loan to purchase plastic shoes and hopes this will help him to expand his business and attract more customers.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to get married and build a house for his family.

He is in his second loan cycle and has borrowed 45,000 KSH to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes.

loans.name: Nellious

texts.en:
Nellious is a 22-year-old woman with 1 child.

She has had a shoe business for 3 years. She will use the loan to purchase shoes to expand her business and provide for her child.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a plot of land.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed 40,000 KSH to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 46-year-old single woman who is enjoying her life educating herself and benefiting from her time studying.

She is studying geography and is in process of acquiring her Masters degree.

She earns her living from selling olives and olive oil during harvesting season.

Her income is invested and covers her living needs through the year. That's why she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her Masters in geography degree tuition expenses.

She is working hard to graduate and continue educating herself.

loans.use: to pay for her Masters in geography degree tuition expenses.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Nancy, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married, a mother to four children, and known by her community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Nancy joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Nancy plans to buy more land to cultivate.

Between the 12 farmers in Nancy's Group, a total of 7 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jenifer's Group

texts.en:
Jenifer is a 32-year-old woman with 5 children. She has been a farmer for 17 years and is a very reliable person. Even though Jenifer is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Jenifer started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2009 and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Jenifer’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. The group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is a responsible woman with two sons. She divorced and it’s hard for her to provide for her family. Her sons are well-bread and obedient and she loves them very much. She tries to provide for the well-being of her children. She wants to reach goals for her life and has sold men’s clothing for 3 years.

She is going to get a loan to treat her teeth.

She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To treat her teeth

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 26-year-old single woman blessed with three children. She has operated a profitable retail shop for three years. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will buy cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar and detergent to sell. She hopes to make more income and educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, make more income, and be successful.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar and detergent.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts in previously lending her 25,000 PHP. It really helped her buy more merchandise to sell in her variety store. It also enabled her to put up a little coffee shop beside her store. This development encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is forever grateful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her 27,000 PHP to purchase rice, canned goods, snack items, soft drinks, and charcoal. The income that she can obtain from these will augment their daily household needs.

She prays for a long life and good health so she can continue enhancing her business. Every week she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, snack items, soft drinks, and charcoal.

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en:
Rabo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Rabo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide farm employment to members of his community.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a 35-year-old divorced woman with four children, who has had a home-based clothing business for 4 years.

She is the sole breadwinner for seven members and works hard to develop her business in a well managed way to make sure she can reply to their daily living needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to invest in developing her newly established business. Through her acquired loan, she will increase her business merchandise with special newly-released winter collections.

Suzana is working hard to develop her business and meet both her family and customer's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special newly-released winter collections.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes is an extremely friendly person. She is the 35-year-old group leader representing a 14-farmer group in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and has 4 children.

Agnes is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Agnes says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has learned a lot from farming trainings, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Agnes will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is maize farmer from Mai Yamma Talata village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ado is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ado can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ado is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shuaibu

texts.en:
Shuaibu is a maize farmer from Mai Yamma Talata village. As a member of Babban Gona, Shuaibu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shuaibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shuaibu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shuaibu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Deborah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Deborah would have had to sell her maize at harvest time when the price of maize is at its lowest, in order to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Deborah can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when she can obtain the best price, with a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Deborah no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Deborah hopes to realize better yields, and she plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es: Martha tiene 27 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, ella se dedica hace 4 años a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, ya que a esta actividad se ha convertido en una gran fuente de trabajo, solicita el crédito para poder incrementar una nueva máquina para realizar buenos acabados en sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha, 27, is single and has been making clothing for four years. Her business has become a great source of work.

She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine to give her products a better finish.

loans.use: to invest in her tailor business.

loans.name: Francisca Adelia

texts.es:
Francisca, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es carpintero, tiene 3 hijos, 2 están estudiando y la otra hija ya trabaja para ayudar a sus padres.

Francisca, tiene una tienda desde hace 2 años en su propia casa, decidió poner este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que ella anteriormente solo atendía a su familia, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en los tiempos libres en atender la tienda y con los oficios domésticos de la casa.

Francisoc, necesita el préstamo para comprar jabón, rinso, aceite, arroz y productos que le hacen falta para su negocio; de esa manera pretende hacer crecer su inventario, para tener una mayor variedad de los artículos que ofrece. 

Francisca, sueña con hacer crecer su tienda, para ayudar a que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y así lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta completar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Francisca has a sixth grade education. She is married to a carpenter and has three children; two attend school and her daughter works to help her parents.

Francisca has been running a store in her home for two years. She decided to set it up in order to help her husband with the household expenses, as before she only attended to the family. Her children and husband help with the store and household chores in their free time.

Francisca is in need of a loan to buy soap, detergent, oil, rice and other products she needs for the business. This will allow her to add more stock and be able to offer a wider variety of products.

Francisca dreams of expanding her store to help her family enjoy a better quality of life and insure that her children can complete their education.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, oil, rice and products for her business.

loans.name: Ivo

texts.pt: Ivo is a student at of an agricultural institute in rural, southern Mozambique. In this program, he has been given the opportunity to be an extension worker, so he can earn some income to also help provide for his family. Ivo will visit farmers in the region and bring them important materials like chemicals and fertilizers, and will provide advice on how to improve their crops. Each farmer pays for these services, so the more farmers he can visit each week, the more he can earn. With a bicycle, he can double his visits and double his weekly income, while helping more farmers to improve their crop yields.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle and spare parts so he can visit farmers to provide agricultural assistance and deliver fertilizers

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a student at an agricultural institute in rural, southern Mozambique.
