In this program, she has been given the opportunity to be an extension worker, so she can earn some income to also help provide for her family. She will visit farmers in the region and bring them important materials like chemicals and fertilizers, and she will provide advice on how to improve their crops. The more farmers she can visit each week, the more she can earn. With a bicycle, she expects to double her visits to farmers and double her weekly income. Isabel is the oldest of four children, and so her income provides for her family as well.

loans.use: to buy a quality bicycle and spare parts to increase the number of farmers that this Agriculture Student and Extension worker can visit

loans.name: Agriculture Students I Group

texts.en: In Mozambique, less than 20% of people have a secondary education. Mário, however, is passionate about agriculture and have achieved a placement in higher education at an agricultural institute in rural, southern Mozambique. His education also includes acting as extension workers, so he can earn some income to provide for their families as well.  Mário and his colleagues will visit farmers in the region and bring them important materials like chemicals and fertilizers, and provide advice on how to improve their crops. The more farmers they can visit each week, the more they earn. With a bicycle, they can each visit two times the farmers and double their weekly incomes.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle and spare parts to visit farmers and earn wages for agricultural assistance and delivery of fertilizers

loans.name: Agriculture Students Ii Group

texts.en: In Mozambique, less than 20% of people have a secondary education. Pedro however, is passionate about agriculture and has achieved a placement in higher education at an agricultural institute in rural, southern Mozambique. His education also includes acting as an extension worker, so he can earn some income to provide for his families as well. Along with his colleagues, he will visit farmers in the region and bring them important materials like chemicals and fertilizers, and provide advice on how to improve their crops. The more farmers they can visit each week, the more they earn. With a bicycle, they can each visit two times the farmers and double their weekly incomes.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle and spare parts to visit farmers and earn wages for agricultural assistance and delivery of fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Alexandre

texts.en: In Mozambique, less than 20% of people have a secondary education and over 60% of people are illiterate. The conditions do not make it easy for people to reach schools, but Ana's son Paulo loves learning and so he walks two hours each way to reach his school every day. Sometimes, he stays at his Grandmother's home to be closer, although that is still an hour walk from his school. Ana is seeking a loan to buy a quality bicycle so her son can reach school in under 30 minutes. He will have more time to help around the house and complete homework, and will not have to walk in the dark every day. Moreover, he will use the bicycle on the weekends to help Ana sell things in the market near their home.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for her son, who walks over 2 hours to school each day

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 48 years old and is separated from her husband. She has 5 school age kids with her. She lives in Ozamiz City. For the past ten years Carmelita has been a farmer. She earns 8,000 PHP each month and has been an active member of PMPC since March 8, 2007. Carmelita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as a frying pan, glass, rice cooker, scoop, bucket, spoon, plate, kettle and other things to sell. Joana started to open her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital of $100. 
She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, glass, rice cooker, scoop, bucket, spoon, plate, kettle and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cruz Clementina

texts.es: Clemencia tiene 35 años de edad. es de estado civil casada, es una persona responsable y muy dedicada con su trabajo, tiene dos hijos Mateo de 11 años y Fernando de 9 años de edad quienes estudian en una institucion de su localidad, Clemencia se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos hace 10 años, ella solicita el credito para invertier en mas crias, ya que esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Clemencia, 35, is married and she is a responsible person who is very dedicated to her work. She has two children, Mateo, 11, and Fernando, 9, who attend the local school.

Clemencia raises and sells pigs and has been in business for ten years. She is requesting a loan to buy more piglets since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to raise and sell pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old. She is a single mother blessed with 2 children. She has had a construction supplies business for 5 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has borrowed KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan, after paying the previous loan successful. She will be using the loan to purchase construction materials. Therefore, she hopes that the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her kids, cater for medical care, to save in her personal savings account, to expand the current business and to repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established  business and to enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, de 27 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene una niña de 2 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y trabaja en la agricultura sembrando maíz y su esposa trabaja en una tienda. 

Ricardo, trabaja en la agricultura y eso le ayuda a generar los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia, por eso hace unos meses decidió iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de mariscos en su motocicleta, esto le ha permitido mejorar los ingresos económicos.

Ricardo, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mariscos y vender en las comunidades cercanas. 

El sueño principal de Ricardo, es construir su vivienda y brindarle protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo, aged 27, is married and has a 2 year old daughter. He studied up to ninth grade and works in agriculture, sowing corn, and his wife works in a shop.

Ricardo is an agricultural worker, which helps him earn the income he needs to support his family. A few months ago he decided to start his own business selling shellfish from his motorbike, which has helped him to improve his financial income.

Ricardo needs this loan to buy more shellfish and sell them in the neighbouring communities.

Ricardo's main dream is to build a house and protect his family.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish and sell them in the neighbouring communities.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida en casa de su propiedad desde hace 30 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, además presta sus servicios domésticos obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. Sonia desea reparar el cuarto en el que vive, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, lámina, clavos y alambre para reparar el cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Sonia is a 41 year old hardworking woman who has lived with her life's companion in a house she owns for 30 years. She is a hardworking woman who sells beauty products via catalog. She also offers domestic services, obtaining more income. Sonia wants to repair the room where she lives, because it has deteriorated. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, sheeting, nails and wire to repair the room where she lives.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheeting, nails and wire to repair the room in her house.

loans.name: Jeanafe

texts.en: Jeanafe has been running her business for many years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm, such as, manure

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es: La señora Dorotea vive en el área rural, con dos hijos dependientes económicamente, su vivienda es rustica con techo de paja brava, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad lleva 30 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción en las ferias semanales de la región. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, habas y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. Otra de las actividades a la que se dedica comercialización de colchones de echas de paja brava. La señora Dorotea se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo económico para la compra de abono orgánico y semilla de papa, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción y mejorar su calidad de vida. Es una persona de escasos recursos que tiene mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante aunque ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien falleció hace 20 años pero eso no le detuvo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dorotea lives in a rural area with two children who are financially dependent on her. She has a rustic home with a straw thatched roof that lacks some basic services. She is a hard-working person who works very optimistically every day to earn the financial income to support herself.

She primarily works in agriculture, which she has been doing for about 30 years, producing and selling her products at the local weekly markets. She takes her products to local provincial markets and neighbouring villages. Her main crops are potatoes and beans on a large scale and she grows others on a smaller scale, generally for her own consumption. She also works selling straw mattresses.

Dorotea needs to request this financial loan to buy organic fertiliser and potato seeds to expand her production and improve her quality of life. She has limited resources but a lot of enthusiasm for moving forward, although she is no longer supported by her husband, who died 20 years ago. However, this has not stopped her from moving forward.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser and potato seeds to expand her production and generate more income.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is 38 years old and has two children. Armida is married and has two children who are in school.

Armida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Armida requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Armida has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Armida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Silpa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silpa, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada y tiene dos hijos con su esposo, ambos estudian.

Silpa, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 5 meses; también tiene una pequeña crianza de cerdos, su esposo le ayuda también a trabajar en la agricultura; decidió colocar una tienda en la zona donde vive, porque no hay mucha competencia y es bastante habitada. 

Silpa, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, café, azúcar, pan, detergente, entre otros productos para mejorar el inventario de su tienda.

Silpa, sueña con tener un negocio bien establecido y darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silpa, aged 29, studied up to eighth grade, is married and has two children with her husband, who are both in school.

Silpa has owned a small shop for five months. She also has a pig farm, and her husband also helps her with agricultural work. She decided to set up a shop in the area where she lives as there is not much competition and a fairly large population.

Silpa needs this loan to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, bread and detergent, among other products, to improve her shop's inventory.

Silpa dreams of having a well-established business and providing for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, bread and detergent, among other products, to improve her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Yancy Abigail

texts.es: Yancy es una mujer trabajadora de 22 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de pupusas y productos de medicina natural, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año y que le permite salir adelante junto a su compañero de vida, con el que vive en casa propia. Ella desea invertir en su venta de medicina natural y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar productos de medicina natural para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Yancy is a hardworking 22 year old woman who sells pupusas and natural medicine products. She has done this activity for 1 year and it allows her to get ahead with her life's companion, with whom she lives in their own house. She wants to invest in her natural medicine sales and to do that she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy natural medicine products to offer her customers a wider variety.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine products to offer her customers a better variety.

loans.name: Juana Gladis

texts.es:
Juana, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, vive junto a su hija de 23 años de edad y su otro hijo de nueve años de edad que se encuentra estudiando nivel básico. 

Juana, se dedica al comercio de productos de uso personal, como lociones, desodorantes, shampoos, entre otros, también vende enchape de plata y cobre, es por eso que conoce muy bien la actividad que realiza, también se dedica a la producción de granos básicos.

Juana, necesita el préstamo para comprar lociones, shampoos, entre otros productos de uso personal.

Juana, sueña con tener a su familia en mejores condiciones de vida y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana, is 38 years old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. She lives with her 23 year old daughter and her nine year old son who is in elementary school.

Juana sells personal use products such as lotions, deodorants, shampoos, and more. She also sells silver and gold plated jewelry, and that is why she knows her own activity so well. She also grows basic grains.

Juana needs the loan to buy lotions, shampoos, and other personal use products.

Juana dreams of her family having better living conditions and for her children to get and education and have good careers.

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoos, and other personal use products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor es casado, es de Potosí, con residencia en el trópico, tiene tres hijo dependientes, es trabajador,  responsable su actividad económica es agricultor, el empezó a trabajar como jornalero ganando su dinero día a día con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio hasta que se compró un chaco. Es una persona muy trabajador empezó desde muy joven a realizar dichos trabajos y con tanto esfuerzo se compró un lote de terreno urbano y agrícola en el pueblo donde actualmente vive, pero el 17/06/2015 su esposa se hospitalizo por un dolor abdominal tipo cólico además de náuseas y vomito en que no desaparecía, y los médicos le realizaron unos exámenes de laboratorios  a fondo para saber el porqué del dolor y su diagnóstico que tiene un tumor, esta enfermedad es desde hace 8 años atrás y debe ser intervenida quirurgicamente lo más antes posible para reestablecerse y continuar con sus actividades de manera normal, por tal motivo decidió solicitar el préstamo, se realizó todos los tramites se obtuvo el informe médico para validad su solicitud de la Señor a favor de su esposa.
texts.en:
This borrower is married. He is from Potosi and lives in a tropical area. He has three dependent children. The borrower is hard-working and responsible.

The borrower's main source of income is from work as a farmer. The borrower began his career working as a labourer. He earned a little money every day and, with a lot of effort and sacrifice, he was able to buy a farm.

The borrower is very hard-working and has been involved in farming since he was very young. With a lot of effort, he bought farming land in his local town; he now lives there.

Unfortunately, on 17 June 2015, the borrower's wife was hospitalised owing to prolonged stomach pain, nausea and vomiting. Doctors carried out many tests to identify the cause of the pain and found a tumour. The tumour has been there for eight years and surgery ASAP is now necessary so that they might recover and continue with their normal activities.

The borrower has therefore decided to apply for a loan. He has all the medical reports required to confirm that he needs a loan for his wife.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for his wife so that he can return to work.

loans.name: Andrea Adelina

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer que ha salido adelante por sí sola, a sus sesenta y un años de edad y siendo madre de cuatro hijos, trabaja cada día duro para ser una mujer fuerte, independiente y exitosa. Posee un negocio de venta de comida. Todas las tardes a partir de las cinco, inicia a ofrecer sus deliciosos platillos. 
En estos momentos, Andrea está experimentando cambios significativos, su negocio está creciendo, por lo tanto ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Kiva junto a MiCrédito el cual lo quiere para mejorar la infraestructura de su local, para asi poder albergar cómodamente a más clientes. En un futuro desea poder reemplazar su cocina artesanal por equipos con tegnologia moderna para así ofrecer más calidad y vender desayunos, almuerzos y cenas.
texts.en:
Andrea has prospered by herself. As a 61-year-old and mother of four she works hard every day to be a strong, independent and successful woman. She owns a food sales business. Every afternoon starting at five she provides her delicious dishes.  

Andrea is currently undergoing significant changes, her business is growing and so she is requesting Kiva for a loan, through MiCrédito, to be used in the improvement of the structure of her premises, to be able to comfortably accommodate more customers. 

In the future she hopes to be able to replace her traditional kitchen with modern technology equipment, providing better quality, and to sell breakfast, lunch and dinner.

loans.use: to improve the structure of her premises.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, de 41 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, los cuales estudian y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos.

Efraín, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, su padre fue quien le enseño todas estas labores desde que era un niño, posee una parcela en la cual trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes.

Efraín, necesita el préstamo para poder pagar mozos que le ayuden sacar sus cultivos, porque está en el punto que tiene que cortarlos.

El sueño de Efraín, es ver crecer a sus hijos que con tanto amor a criado.
texts.en:
Efraín, 41, did not attend school. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, the children attend school and his wife is a homemaker.

He has earned a living in agriculture for many years now, his father taught him this work since he was a child. Efrain owns a plot of land where he works every day, mornings and afternoons. He is applying for this loan to hire help to work with the crops, which are ready to be harvested.

Efrain's dream is to see his children grow up, he's raised them with great love.

loans.use: to hire help to work with his crops which are ready to be harvested.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro es un hombre trabajador de 49 años de edad que vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 22, 18, 12 y 20 años de edad, a los que han logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo.  Él se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace mucho tiempo, además cultiva la tierra brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Isidro desea invertir en productos de medicina natural, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar medicina natural para vender y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isidro is a hardworking man of 49 who lives with his life partner and their 4 children (aged 22, 18, 12 and 20), for whom they have managed to provide with great effort. 

He has sold natural medicine for a long time, together with farming land to provide better living conditions for his family.

Isidro wishes to invest in natural medicine products and so he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase natural medicine to sell, offering a greater variety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine to sell, offering a greater variety to his customers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La señora Isabel es nacida en Potosí – Chayanta, emigro al trópico de Cochabamba desde hace 15 años atrás junto con su cónyuge para juntos trabajar pero a la fecha la abandono, ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos dependientes el cual mantiene, ella está sola desde hace 3 años atrás, anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica aveces asta como ayudante de cocina, con los ahorros generados se compró un lote urbano actualmente no cuenta con los servicios básicos, un día visito a la abuelita de sus hijos ella tenía su  tienda de barrio en su propio domicilio, se lo cedió la tienda a la señora Isabel porque ella se encuentra mal de salud para ayudarla económicamente a sobre salir, de la tienda paga solo 180 bs de alquiler, esa tienda lo adquirió desde hace un año atrás actualmente necesita un préstamo para su capital de inversión para la tienda de barrio y así obtendrá más ingresos y sacara a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Chayanta, Potosi, and moved to the tropical area of Cochabamba 15 years ago. She moved with her partner so that they could work. Isabel's partner, however, has since left her. Isabel is a single mother. She has three children who depend on their mother. Isabel has been alone for three years now.

Previously Isabel worked as a domestic servant and sometimes as a kitchen helper. She used savings from this work to buy a plot of land but she does not have utilities such as running water and electricity.

One day Isabel went to visit her children's grandmother. She used to have a grocery shop in her home. The grandmother gave Isabel the shop because she is now ill. The shop helps Isabel to move forward financially. Isabel pays only 180 Bolivianos in rent for the shop. She took on the shop one year ago. She currently needs a loan to invest in the shop. She can thus earn a higher income and move forward with her family.

loans.use: to improve her grocery shop and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Visia Aurora

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Al Poder se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Aurora, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, con ellos vive un nieto de 6 años que está en escuela y es como su hijo ya que lo tiene desde pequeño. Su marido no trabaja por su avanzada edad. 
Aurora  es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos que les ayuden a salir adelante ya que su marido por la edad ya no trabaja, para esto ella hace mas de 40 años atrás con lo que tenia surtió una tienda de víveres en su casa, empezó con muy poco y con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando cada vez, mas actualmente tiene un local bien surtido ya que además de víveres también vende artículos de bazar y papelería, allí ella trabaja todos los días brindando la mejor atención pues esa es la clave de su negocio el buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes razón por lo cual la prefieren a la hora de realizar sus compras.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda va a comprar víveres y artículos de bazar. Lleva un año   en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Mujeres al Poder credit group meets every other week in the Pajan canton, a canton known by its livestock industry in the province. One of its attractions is the Montubio rodeo organised in some periods of the year.

In this place lives Aurora, she is 62 years old. She is married and she has three adult children from this relationship. A 6 year old grandchild lives with them, he goes to school and he is like her child since she has him since he was young. Her husband is not working due to his advanced age.

Aurora is a woman who likes to provide for herself and to generate her own income to help them get ahead. Her husband does not work due to his advanced age. For this reason, she has stocked a grocery store at her home for more than 40 years. She started with very little and over time she has been improving each time. Nowadays she has a very well stocked shop. Besides groceries she also sells stationery items. Every day she works there giving the best customer service since this is the key of her business: the good customer service she offers to her customers. This is the reason why they prefer her when they have to do their shopping.

She will be using this loan to better stock her shop. She will buy groceries and stationery items. She has been in the credit group for one year and she likes it because the loans are given fast. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and stationery items.

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
Luz, de 54 años de edad, es conocida como una persona que pese a las adversidades de la vida ha logrado salir adelante, porque hace algunos años sufrió un accidente y su pierna derecha perdió movilidad, ella solo estudio hasta sexto grado y vive solo con una hija y su pequeña nieta.
 
Luz, a lo largo del tiempo ha trabajado en diferentes tipos de actividades; actualmente posee una pequeña venta de joyería con la cual genera ingresos económicos para cubrir sus necesidades, pero además de eso vende comida.

Luz, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía para vender (pulseras, collares, aretes y anillos) porque se ha quedado con poca mercadería y sus clientes le piden más variedad de productos. 

El sueño de Luz, es ver crecer a su pequeña nieta y que se convierta en una profesional; también desea que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Luz, 54, is known as a person who has been able to get ahead in spite of life's adversities, because a few years ago she had an accident and lost mobility in her right leg. She only attended school until the sixth grade, and lives with a daughter and her little granddaughter.

Luz has worked in a variety of different jobs over the years. Now she has a small business selling jewelry, which generates income to cover her basic needs. Aside from this, she also sells food. Luz needs the loan to buy more merchandise to sell (bracelets, necklaces, earrings and rings) because she has little stock left and her customers are asking for a greater variety of products.

Luz's dream is to see her granddaughter grow up and become a professional; she also would like to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell (bracelets, necklaces, earrings and rings).

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
O sr Ernesto tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de dois filhos dos quais um frequenta a escola e outro ainda é menor de idade. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta ainda o seu irmão e a sua prima.
O valor de empréstimo será aplicado na compra de gás, tubos, filtros para revender  e sonha em ser empresário  e neste momento enfrenta dificuldades financeiras para concretizar o sonho.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 27 years old, married, and the father of two children; one goes to school and the other one is still very young. Besides his two children, he still maintains his brother and a cousin.

With the requested amount, he will buy gas, pipes, and filters for resale. He dreams of becoming a businessman. He is currently facing some financial difficulties to realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy gas, pipes, and filters to sell.

loans.name: Gevinor Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the featured borrower of Gevinor group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have all became close friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to seek a better income to support their beloved families.

Josephine is a 51-year-old married mother. Since her family's needs are increasing, she has started her own -- as she calls it -- "mini store." There she sells diversified goods to her Filipino friends during their weekend vacation. This helps to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and improve their living conditions.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

Josephine is the lady standing at the far left side of the picture, Jovita is the second from the left, Lourdes is the second from the right, Marilyn is the first on the right, while llyn is the lady at the center of the picture.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, desde muy joven le han enseñado a trabajar, actualmente vive con su esposo y su hija, la cual trabaja como vendedora y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Catalino, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace más de 25 años, su negocio es comprar cerdos, los cría, los engorda y los vende o los destaza para vender; además de eso trabaja la agricultura sembrando granos básicos como maíz.

Catalino, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos porque se los están vendiendo a buen precio, de esa manera podrá seguir trabajando y generando ingresos económicos para su familia.

El sueño de Catalino, es seguir trabajando con ganado y mantener buena salud.
texts.en:
Catalino, 57, attended school until the first grade. He was taught to work from a very young age. Now he lives with his wife and daughter, who works as a vender, and his wife manages the housework.

Catalino has been raising pigs for over twenty-five years. His business is buying pigs, raising them, fattening them, and selling them or butchering them for sale; he also works in agriculture growing staple grains like corn. Catalino needs the loan to buy pigs because they are being sold at a good price. In this way he could continue to work and generate income for his family. Catalino's dream is to keep on working raising animals and stay in good health.

loans.use: to buy pigs because they are selling them at a good price.

loans.name: Felix

texts.pt:
O senhor Félix de 38 anos de idade é casado pai de 5 filhos destes 02 a estudarem 03 ainda menores e sem idade escolar vive na casa própria. 
Com o valor quer comprar cimento, varröes, areia, para iniciar a sua obra actualmente vive numa feita de material precário.
Para o futuro pretende fazer e concluir a sua obra, mobilar, ter uma viatura para fazer transporte de alunos na sua zona.
Diz que a insuficiência de fundos e o seu desafio e para supera-lo conta com ajuda de sua esposa que faz machambas e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos  para concretizar o seu projecto.
texts.en:
Félix, 38, is married and the father of five children. Two of them go to school, and the remaining three are not of school age yet. He owns the house where he lives.

With the requested amount, he will buy cement, columns, and sand to start building his house. He lives in one made with rustic materials.

In the future, he plans to start and finish building his house, furnish it, and buy a vehicle to transport students in his area.

He says that his challenge is the lack of funding, and his wife, who works in agriculture, helps him to overcome it. He also says that he will apply for more loans to realize his project.

loans.use: to buy cement, columns, and sand to start building his new house. He lives now in one made with rustic materials.

loans.name: Eulalio Esau

texts.es: Eulalio vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en casa de sus padres, por lo que se siente feliz. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Eulalio desea invertir en más productos para su negocio, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar productos de medicina natural para su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Eulalio lives with his parents and siblings in his parents' house, which makes him feel happy. He is a hardworking man who sells natural medicines, something he has been doing for two years. Being able to contribute to the family's sustenance makes him feel happy.

Eulalio wants to invest in more products for his business, so he decided to apply for a loan at FUSAI to buy natural medicines for his business to improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for his business to improve his sales.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives at Ubong with her family. She is a hog raiser and gets income from selling the raised hogs to butchers in their village.

She wants to continue improving her hogs' growth and nutrition, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs sustenance.

She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Bernadet

texts.en:
Bernadet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bernadet is 56 years old now.

Bernadet has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Bernadet requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy t-shirts, pants, underwear, etc.

In the future, Bernadet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La señora Primitiva es una mujer emprendedora de 57 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que depende de ella. Hace más de medio año que la señora Primitiva realizo capacitaciones en el rubro de panadería y refrigerios. Ahora que conoce mejor el rubro desea comprar maquinaria y equipo especial para la elaboración de sus productos, dándole a su negocio un enfoque más empresarial, dado que la señora primitiva preparaba sus productos de manera más artesanal.  
La cliente cuenta con buenas expectativas ya que a ella lo que más le motiva es salir adelante y con varias metas por realizar, quiere llegar a formar un capital de trabajo que le pueda brindar una mayor estabilidad económica.
La cliente viene de una familia humilde y sobre todo trabajadora la cual esta inculcada con los valores de humildad, buena administración de recursos, respeto, con una visión de emprendimiento y alcanzar los objetivos que ella misma se traza a lo largo de su carrera técnica.
texts.en:
Primitiva is a 57-year-old entrepreneur. She has two children who depend on her. More than six months ago, Primitiva received training in bakery and meal cooking. She is more experienced now, and wants to buy machinery and special equipment to make her products, and give her business a more industrial approach, since she used to make her products in a traditional way.

Primitiva has positive expectations because she wants to get ahead and has several goals she wants to achieve. She wants to have enough working capital to reach financial stability.

Primitiva comes from a humble, but most of all hardworking family, founded on values such as humility, good resources management, and respect. She has an entrepreneurial vision and wants to achieve the goals she has set for herself throughout her career.

loans.use: to buy machinery and special equipment to make her products and improve the family's income.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a mother of five children. Primitiva wants to give a financially secure life to her children. She is working hard just to send her children to school.

She has owned and managed her farm for many years. Her husband is a farmer, and he is the one helping Primitiva in cultivating their farm to make it more productive.

She wants to gain more profit on it and engage in some other business activities. She joined GDMPC and recently she took a new loan to buy fertilizer such as manure and to pay for labor costs for the next cropping.

Primitiva's future plans are to save more money to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs for her rice farm.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase flour, sugar, oil and other supplies for her business.

Since her last loan, Riziki's family living standard has improved as she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

Riziki is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 28 years old, married to Antony, and blessed with two children aged 12 and 4 years old.

She has been in the new clothes selling business for one year and earns a monthly income of KES 11,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more clothes for resale in the market.

With the anticipated income, Lucy will be able to help her husband in paying school fees for their children from her increased business profits.

Her dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Acila

texts.en:
Acila is 42 years old; she's married and has four children to provide for.

Acila is a farmer who cultivates her own land. Her goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her four children and her family.

Annabelle needs to pay school fees and also cover her household expenses. Acila is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her rice production. She is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity.

Acila hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her rice production

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 62 years old and married with two adult-age children.

She is known for her dried fish retailing business in Ozamiz City. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, where she accesses various products, including loan products and insurance services.

Recently, she requested a loan to buy bulk inventories of dried fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy bulk inventories of dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Nuru Hakofa

texts.en: Nuru is 39 years old, married to Weldon, and blessed with seven children aged between 20 years and 2 years old. She has been in the tea and milk selling business for eight years, and earns a monthly income of KES 35,000. This is her second loan with VFK, and she intends to buy more tea and milk for resale in the village. She anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the increased business profits. Her hopes and dreams are to live a better life.

loans.use: to increase her stock of milk and tea.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child.

Evelyn has been engaged in the hog raising business for one year already. She is also receiving monthly support from her husband. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials like tiles, hollow blocks, and steel bars for repairs.

Evelyn became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like tiles, hollow blocks, and steel bars.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 44 years old. He is married to Mary who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with five children.

He has had a farming business for 10 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. He has borrowed KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his third loan, after repaying the previous loan successfully.

Julius will be using the loan to purchase animal feed and farm inputs. He hopes that the anticipated profits will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his kids, cater for medical care, and save in his personal savings account for expanding his current business and repaying his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and farm inputs.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso, de 63 años de edad, nunca estudio, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 nietos.

Alfonso, es un señor de avanzada edad, posee una tortillería desde hace más de 5 años, anteriormente su esposa era la que hacia las tortillas y él se encargaba de cocer el maíz y llevarlo al molino; pero su esposa ya no puede trabajar y por esa razón emplearon una joven para que hiciera las tortillas y para que las fuera a vender, todos trabajan desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Alfonso, necesita el préstamo para comprar otra plancha para hacer tortillas, porque la que tiene está en mal estado y es necesario cambiarla, para que el negocio siga funcionando bien.

Alfonso, sueña con seguir vendiendo tortillas y ayudando a esta joven con el empleo.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 63, could not study. He is married, and lives with his wife and two grandchildren.

Alfonso is of advanced age. He has had a tortillería for more than five years. Her wife used to make the tortillas, and he was in charge of cooking and grinding the corn. However, his wife cannot work anymore, which is why they employed a young woman to make and sell the tortillas. They all work from 5 am until 3 pm.

Alfonso needs the loan to buy another griddle to make tortillas, because the one he has is in bad shape and he needs to replace it to keep his business running.

Alfonso dreams of continuing selling tortillas and helping her young employee.

loans.use: to buy another griddle to make tortillas.

loans.name: Spice Girls3 Group

texts.en:
Mauricia is the featured borrower of Spice Girls3 group. Along with the other group members, she is taking out a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua; they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon, where they can earn better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Mauricia is a 51-year-old divorced mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Analyn is the lady on the right, and Janet is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 47 years old. She is known in the Sindangan area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) offers. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house. 

Genevieve requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Esterni

texts.en:
Esterni is juggling managing her vegetable growing business and supervising the construction of her housing project.

Esterni hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 30,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Esterni has been given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for: when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of lumber for her housing project.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Mercedes came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most.

Now, she has taken another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Mercedes perseveres and always believes in reaching for her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Nyalali

texts.en:
Nyalali is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more charcoal for resale.

With her last loan she was able to improve her business by buying more charcoal. She aspires to keep expanding her business in order to have better living standards.

Nyalali says her previous loan helped improve living standards of her family, and she is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lydia Wairimu

texts.en:
Lydia has always a wanted biogas system, but the initial upfront cost prevented her from getting one.

She got interested in Takamoto biogas loans because of their affordability and flexible repayment rates.

With the loan, she will be able to get clean and reliable fuel and also prevent deforestation.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean, convenient cooking.

loans.name: Avon Group

texts.en:
Flordeliza is the featured borrower of Avon Group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. The group members have been friends since they came to work in Lebanon, having left their hometowns in the Philippines seeking a better future. They trust and care for each other.

Flordeliza is a 38-year-old, married mother of three. She has been working in Lebanon as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her family's house in the Philippines. She is the first lady on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Maritess is the lady in the middle, and Ludimin is the first on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her family's house in the Philippines.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27 year old married man living with his wife and his young child, who is still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. He has his business in agriculture.

Due to the hard financial situation, Mohamad is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his child’s school fees. His only purpose is to help him attain high educational levels to help them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his child’s school fees.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a hardworking, ambitious lady who decided to work in a beauty business to support her family members in making their living.

She is a 54-year-old, married mother of three who got the necessary vocational training and experience from her husband, who works in the same domain, too.

Layla is investing her business income in supporting her husband in covering her family's increasing living needs. Thus, any acquired income is not invested in any innovative means. But Layla has always been seeking to buy new furniture for her house, and has been working hard to save the required amount. Unfortunately, the family's needs are stopping her from doing so. That's why she decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy necessary furniture for her house.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en:
Farangis is a hard -working and kind woman. She is divorced and caring mother of two children. Now she is only feed-keeper of her family. She works in a cafe. She is industrious worker and does her job well. Farangis is a recurring customer of IMON.

She requested a loan for treatment of her daughter, as she is ill and Farangis intends on asking for money to treat his daughter. She is asking for 3000 Somoni with this aim. She hopes for your kindness and your help for her daughter to bring better health.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups.

Victoria tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Victoria has borrowed another amount to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher yielding seedlings. This will give her farming income a big boost.

Victoria looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kristina Grace

texts.en:
Kristina Grace is a daughter of a farmer who earns a living by growing vegetables and other crops on their own farm. She is 20 years old and is studying hotel and restaurant management at a university of Dipolog City.

She took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to pay her school tuition fee in full for this semester.

She believes that hard work, determination and sacrifice leads anyone to success. In the future, Kristina Grace plans to invest in a restaurant business to ensure a better source of income for her future family.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fee in full for this semester.

loans.name: Jemaflor

texts.en: Jemaflor is known in Polangyuta, Siquijor for her snack vending business. She is 46 years old, and married with school aged children. She is supported by Paglaum MPC in her business and has maintained her membership in the cooperative without defaulting on any of her payments. Recently, she took out her sixth loan to buy bags of flour, confectioneries, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, confectioneries, etc., for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
With your previous financial support, Ernesto strengthened his sari-sari store business, resulting into a more profitable source of income. Also with that, he was able to add some savings for emergency purposes.

Now, he's more than dedicated and passionate in cultivating his business. Despite some problems like stiff competition and long time debts by some of his neighbors, his will and perspectives never change. In fact, he's still looking forward for more opportunities to grow his inventories.

He's borrowing PHP 15,000 loan that will bring him enough supply of assorted groceries, beverages and fruits to resell. He prays that you'll trust him again because he has proven once that he's faithful in repaying.

He continues to attend the weekly fellowship where he can draw strength and inspiration to push towards his goals. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain enough supply of assorted groceries, beverages and fruits to resell

loans.name: Brigit's Group

texts.en:
Brigit, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 8 farmers in Webuye District. She is 34 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Brigit likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Brigit plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Brigit’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Isyaku

texts.en:
Isyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Isyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Isyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Isyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Isyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Neha's Group

texts.en:
It's been a year since Neha, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, restarted her ancestral business of weaving baskets and brooms. She hails from a small village of Panpose, Odisha, India. It has started off well, and she is able to contribute to half of the total household expenses from her income.

The products have a market, but the investment in raw materials requires capital in a loan. The traditional loan sharks provide loans at high interest rates and unclear conditions, which can terrify any young starter.

In this scenario, Neha, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials and tools in bulk from wholesalers.

Neha is a widow and is the sole earner for her family. She has two children, a son and a daughter who are currently pursuing their studies in school.

Neha is eagerly awaiting your generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and tools in bulk from wholesalers.

loans.name: Khushbaht

texts.en:
Khushbaht was born in 1969 year. He is married and has 4 children. Khushvaht is very careful father for his children and he tries to offer better living condition. Khushbaht lives with his wife, children and mother in a house which is located in the South part of Tajikistan. Khushbaht’s wife has been busy with clothes sales business. Khushbaht works as a driver in a private organization. He works there for 3 months. During this time he has shown himself as industrious and smart.

Now he needs to financial support because his lovely mother is ill. Khushbaht is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of his mother. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of his mother.

loans.name: Layali

texts.en:
Layali is a 22-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is a mother of two children who attend school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. In 2007 he opened a barber shop. Layali is a housewife who takes care of her children and her husband.

She is requesting today to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay for school stationery and materials for her children. Her dream is to ensure them a happy life and to help them achieve high educational levels. She always wants to be able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay for school stationery and materials for her children.

loans.name: Felomino

texts.en: Felomino is managing his eatery business in Poblacion Norte, Maria, Siquijor. He is 55 years old, single and has been into this business for almost 30 years. This has been doing well supporting of his needs. He has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, he loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business. He wants to expand his business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Loreta tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Loreta has borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Loreta looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella finds pleasure doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well.

At the age of 62 and married, Estrella busies herself to sufficiently provide for her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for the capital to support her gardening activities.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides.

In the future, Estrella wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 46-year-old married mother of three children who attend school. She has been working for seven years from her house selling homemade food in order to help her family meet their daily needs and live in a good way. Her husband owns a mini market in his town.

Today, Hoda is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to ameliorate her business merchandise and to give the best product to her clients and therefore increase her income. She is very happy and optimistic that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that, in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to ameliorate her business merchandise.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 34 years old and has four children. Margie is married and has four children are still in school.

Margie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Margie has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Pathani to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Pathani is 59 years old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita works hard to support her family. Rita is single, 53 years old and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rita has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Azra Bibi

texts.en:
Azra is a 23-year-old, married woman and a mother of one child who attends school. Azra is a housewife living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Azra's husband works hard to support her family. He has an auto rickshaw transportation service in Multan, Pakistan.

Azra is borrowing 30,000 PKR through BRAC Pakistan in order to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband’s transportation services business.

Azra has been sustaining her husband’s business activities through her past one loan from BRAC Pakistan. Azra and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a married woman. She is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment; which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment, to increase sales

loans.name: Mika

texts.en:
Mika is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mika has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mika would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mika can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Mika will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mika is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Daniel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Daniel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Daniel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rahila no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Rahila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Sovanna works as village chief in Chhunleav Village over 10 years living with wife (both in the picture standing in-front of their house) and a child. Beside paper work as village chief, he helps his wife do farming and also feed the pigs. His house needs energy to bright her house and also his small feeding farm. However, his house doesn’t have reliable energy. He has to go to charge battery 1 or 2 time per week.

As a result, he decided to apply for Kiva loan. He believes solar home system can help his family reduce utility cost and improve his working hour at night.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Chhunleav Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 41 years old Lebanese married woman and mother of three children, who are still studying. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he is a retired officer in the international security forces. Today, she is in need to borrow a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the stationary and materials for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a good education for them what makes her very happy and thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the stationary and materials for her children.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Joan is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

Joan has a buy and sell sea foods business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sea foods like shrimp, crabs and etc.

Joan has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sea foods like shrimp, crabs and etc

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
Mr Alex is 46 years old and he is married with five children. He has worked in the sales of electrical accessories for more than 9 years. Alex lives in chorkor district, urban town in Accra province.
His family is a low-income household in town, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Alex faces is lack of money to boost capital.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical accessories and sell to his customers satisfaction. He is a reputable person in the community, although this is Alex's third loan with Thanh ID-Ghana, he is the group leader of biakoye group.

With his business profit, Alex hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to further their education and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical accessories and sell to his customers satisfaction.

loans.name: Sabina's Group

texts.en:
Sabina is 49 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Sabina is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Sabina started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Sabina’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Benedettah's Group

texts.en:
Benedettah is 55 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Benedettah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Benedettah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone.

Obtaining this loan means that Benedettah's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Iliya can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Iliya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Iliya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Rhoda is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rhoda would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Rhoda can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rhoda no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Rhoda hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.en:
Norbibi very kind and bright woman. Norbibi lives in a city of Tajikistan with her family. She is careful woman of her four children. Her children are adult. She tries to offer the best condition of life.

Norbibi 25 year ago has begun her business for buying and selling shoes because she needed the money. Norbibi buys shoes in a bulk and retails in a local market in low price. That’s why she finds status among other business women. Norbibi time by time renews the assortment of her goods. Norbibi now is going to buy new winter shoes for this winter season. She is asking for 7000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes for this winter season.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
A senhora Sandra tem 41 anos de idade, solteira e Mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam o ensino primário e Secundário respectivamente. É negociante há mais de cinco anos e com o empréstimo vai comprar fardos de roupa usada para reforçar o negocio.
Ela sonha em reforçar o seu negócio e abraçar outros negócios visto que muita gente faz o negócio similar ao dela.
Neste momento encarra seria dificuldades financeiras, porem, o desfio é trabalhar muito para poder reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 41 years old, single, and the mother of five children who go to primary and secondary school. She has worked as a businesswoman for more than five years.

With the loan, she will buy bales of used clothes to strengthen her business.

She dreams of strengthening her business, and explore other businesses, since many people run similar businesses.

In this moment she faces financial difficulties, so her challenge is to work hard to be able to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothes to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Safiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Safiya would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Safiya can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Safiya will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Safiya is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Primitiva y su esposo, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare; tienen 49 y 51 años de edad, respectivamente, de estado civil casados, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa. y haba en vaina verde, para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal de Colomi, La señora requiere el préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno lechero ya que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra de insumos agrícolas.                                                                                                                                                                       Por último, la señora Primitiva y su esposo se sintieron contentos al tener la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, además de poder contar con nuestra ayuda porque con la compra de ganado vacuno lechero podrán obtener e incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Primitiva and her husband live in Cochabamba, in the Chapare province. They are 49 and 51 years old respectively. The couple is financially independent and both work in farming. They grow potatoes and green beans. They have a strong market, selling their products at the weekly market in Colomi.

Primitiva needs this loan in order to buy bovine dairy cattle as she invested her savings in farming supplies. Primitiva and her husband are happy to be able to take out this loan and to have our help. By buying bovine dairy cattle, the couple will be able to increase their family's assets, and improve their family's quality of life for a better future.

loans.use: to buy bovine dairy cattle to increase production and improve her income for her family.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Посмотрев на этого мужчину невозможно не улыбнуться в ответ. Его зовут Сафарали. Он очень веселый, общительный, приятный и добрый мужчина. Ему 23 года. Он женат. Сафарали один обеспечивает свою семью. Он заботиться о своих пожилых родителей, младшего брата и жены. Сафарали трудится на земле и всю душу вкладывает работу. И конечно результат его труда можно увидеть на фотографии. 
  Сафарали планирует собрать урожай и посадить зимний. А на деньги от кредита он купит минеральные удобрения и семена. 
Сафарали надеется, что его труд не останется без награждения. Кстати он  будущий отец:)
texts.en:
Looking at this man, it's impossible not to smile in response. His name is Safarali and he is a very happy, social, pleasant and kind man. He is 23 and married and he provides for his family on his own. He takes care of his elderly parents, his younger brother and his wife. He works hard on the land and puts his entire soul into his work - of course, you can see the result of this effort in the photo.

Safarali is planning to bring in his harvest and plant winter crops. He will use the loan amount to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He hopes that his efforts will not go unrewarded. By the way, he is going to be a father. :)

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana a sus 44 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando.
