Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años, por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela. Ana desea continuar mejorando su vivienda, ya que anteriormente adquirió un crédito con el cual mejoro las rejas de su vivienda, actualmente solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana, who is 44 years old, lives with her life partner and her two children, who are 11 and 14 years old and are in school. She works selling beauty products by catalog, an activity that she has done for the past 5 years and through which she works with many clients. She wishes to continue improving her home, as she previously obtained a loan with which she improved the fence around her house. She is now applying for a new loan through FUSAI to buy cement, stones, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a room in her home.

loans.use: to buy" cement, stones, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a room in her home.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 24-year-old ambitious single lady. She has a clothes selling shop which she is working hard to develop, since she has a long experience in this domain from supporting her mother who used to run the same business.
Suzan is working hard to develop her business and increase its capital, that's why she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special winter collection.
Suzan is will try her best to develop her business and will make sure to start wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special winter collection.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 28-year-old divorced Lebanese woman living with her parents and four siblings. She started her own business, by opening in her house a small room where she sells and made faux bijoux and accessories with her special selling methods and giving a high quality of products provided, in parallel she work also at her house as a beautician.She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain, in addition to the customer care she offers.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. Salwa is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her job.

loans.use: to increase her jewelry business merchandise.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jackline is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 9 years and 6 years old. She has been in bricks selling business for two years and she also sells clothes. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase firewood for making bricks and have enough stock to supply to construction and building sites. She also plans to buy more stock of clothes for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and provide for her family's needs. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her clothes selling business and open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for making bricks and have enough stock to supply to construction sites and make more income

loans.name: Herlen

texts.en:
Herlen extends her warm appreciation to you for your previous assistance worth PHP 18,000. It has been utilized in purchasing more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings for her canteen which consequently gave additional income for her family.

Now she still longs to continue improving her business. That is why she appeals for PHP 20,000 loan this time. Again, she will buy raw ingredients for her canteen plus cases of beverages. With more ingredients, she can cook different enticing meal recipes and snacks for her customers.

Herlen has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she’s determined to maintain her good record. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her canteen plus cases of beverages

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Fracisca tiene 40 años de  edad nacido en la provincia mizque del departamento de Cochabamba es una persona trabajadora. Su estado civil es soltera porque viven en concubinato tiene 5 hijos (dependientes) por el momento están estudiando y a los que apoya con su educación y alimentación junto a su esposo, la señora menciona que tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario, los escasos recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a seguir estudiando, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, conoció a su esposo con quien actualmente vive en el trópico de Cochabamba se compraron un lotes agrícolas de 17.5604 has. Con sus ahorros se dedican a la agricultura, este año tuvieron gastos porque uno de sus hijo menor estuvo muy delicado de salud se enfermó y gastaron todos sus ahorros, la señora quiere el crédito para mantenimiento de su cultivo (mano de obra para su yuca, cítrico y plátano) pero no le queda más ahorros, es por eso que se aproximó para solicitar un préstamo y así mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 40, was born in the Mizue province in the Cochabamba department. She is a hard-working person. She is not married because she lives in a common-law union. She has five dependent children who are now going to school. Together with her husband she supports their education and supplies their food. She says that she has an elementary school education. Her parents' scarce resources did not help them to have her continue her education. She started working when she was very young.

She met her husband, with whom she lives in the tropics of Cochabamba. They bought some agricultural land, 17.5064 hectares. With their savings they work in agriculture. This year they had expenses because one of the minor children was in very delicate health and got sick. This took all of their savings.

She wants the loan for maintenance of her crops (labor for her cassava, citrus, and bananas). There are no more savings left. That is why she came to request a loan and to improve her standard of living in this way.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her crops (labor for her cassava, citrus, and bananas) in order to increase production and improve sales.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Alfredo de 42 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno propio, tiene su esposa tienen dos hijos que depende de ellos los cuales uno de ellos se encuentran estudiando en el nivel primario, otro en es un niño de 3 años, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Monteagudo. Su principal actividad del solicitante es la producción de leche de ganado vacuno ya que cuenta con capacitación en el centro de educación alternativa SAN ISIDRO. Es por eso que requiere el préstamo que será destinado para la compra de cinco vaquillas productoras de leche, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad por lo tanto podrá generar nuevos ingresos ya que en la zona se tiene buena venta de este producto el cual podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir con sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 42 years old and currently lives and works at home on his own land. Alfredo has two children with his wife. The children both depend on their parents; one is in primary school while the other is still only three years old. The family lives in the Monteagudo municipality of Chuquisaca department.

Alfredo's has bovine cattle. His main work is milk production. He has received training from San Isidro alternative education institution. He now needs a loan in order to buy five milk-producing heifers. By buying these heifers, he will start to earn a higher income as sells of this product are good in the local area. With a higher income, he can improve his and his wife and children's everyday living conditions.

loans.use: to buy five milk-producing heifers to increase production and sales, and to earn a higher income for his family.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 52-year-old proud mother of 11 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 5 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2015, Beatrice has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Beatrice described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 1.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Gidan village. As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Nuhu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nuhu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Nuhu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Gilberto, trabaja en la pesca artesanal desde hace 10 años y además de eso trabaja remendando redes desde muy joven y sale al mar todos los días dependiendo de la marea y se embarca en la tarde para pescar por la noche o por la madrugada.

Gilberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de pesca, porque tiene uno pero ya es muy viejo y el rendimiento es menos. 

Gilberto, sueña con tener un equipo más para poder tener mejores ingresos y además de eso desea ver crecer a todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 35 and studied through the sixth grade. He lives with his wife, who takes care of their home, and his 4 children.

Gilberto has worked in small-scale fishing for 10 years and has also worked mending nets from a very young age. He goes to sea every day depending on the tides and heads out in the evening to fish during the night or early morning hours.

Gilberto needs this loan to buy fishing equipment because the equipment he has is very old and his catch is smaller.

Gilberto hopes to get another set of equipment to increase his income and he also hopes to see all of his children grow up.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment because the equipment he has now is very old and his catch is smaller.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 47 year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, mother and one child. He owns a bakery and a mini restaurant in his town and as for his wife, she also owns a bakery and a mini market in a different town. Due to the bad financial situations he is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his child education fees what makes him very happy that he will able to secure him a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay his child education fees

loans.name: Haknazar

texts.en:
Haknazar is a person who is very kind and merciful. He works at the Hydropower Electric Station as a common worker. He wants to treat his kind mother to make her better. He loves his mother very much. As soon as possible he wants to see his mother healthy.

He will use loan for his mother‘s treatment. He is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. He awaits your help and compassion.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of his mother

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 37 years old, married to David and blessed with six children. She sells firewood and has been in this business for one year. She also operates a kindergarten school. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to buy more stock of firewood for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood for sale and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and vegetables.

Benita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a hard working lady. She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband. She is a 56 years old married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production and her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.

Manzooran ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Manzooran has requested for 40000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Dinnatu

texts.en:
Dinnatu is a maize farmer from Kugawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Dinnatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Dinnatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dinnatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dinnatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Dinnatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Julio Membreño

texts.es:
Julio, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, ellos se encuentran estudiando su nivel básico y su esposa quien se dedica a la comercialización de pescado, desde hace 6 años ella vende pescado de laguna.

Julio, conoce mucho acerca de la pesca artesanal y la comercialización de pescado; esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años y lo aprendió de su padre, quien se empeño en enseñarle para que tuviera una fuente segura de ingresos, con el apoyo de su esposa también se dedica a la producción de granos básicos. 

Julio, necesita el préstamo para comprar redes de pesca, para mejorar la pesca artesanal. 

Julio, sueña con que sus hijos tengan mayor estabilidad económica y también un negocio que le permita la sostenibilidad familiar.
texts.en:
53-year-old Julio went to school until the third grade. He lives with his two children, who are 19 and 17 years old. His children are studying in the "Basic Education" level (this is the equivalent of primary and secondary school in El Salvador). His wife, who works selling fish, has sold fish from the lake for the past 6 years.

Julio knows a great deal about catching and selling fish. He has worked at the trade for the past 8 years and he learned it from his father, who insisted on teaching him the trade so that he could have a steady source of income. With the help of his wife he also works growing grain.

Julio needs the loan to buy fishing nets to better catch fish.

Julio hopes that his children will have greater economic stability and also that his business will allow him to provide for his family.

loans.use: para comprar redes de pesca, para mejorar la pesca artesanal.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Leonora has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Leonora wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina works hard to support her family. Jelina is single, 48 years old and has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines.

Jelina requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grain to sell.

Jelina has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Jelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Rodelin

texts.en:
Rodelin is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school, Rodelin works very hard to provide for them.

Rodelin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, snack foods and etc.

Rodelin has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Rodelin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 35 years old and has three children. Annaliza is married and has three children are currently in school.

Annaliza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Annaliza has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rina Lisseth

texts.es:
Rina, de 22 años de edad, solo estudiar hasta sexto grado, no pudo seguir estudiando, es madre soltera, su esposo se separo al saber que estaba embarazada, solo vive con su mamá y un sobrino.

Rina, desde que tenía 10 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar sembrando maíz y frijol, este oficio lo aprendió gracia a su mamá, pues su papá murió cuando apenas era muy niña.- Hace dos años comenzó a vender ropa, la falta de dinero la obligo a buscar otra manera de generar ingresos para su familia, este negocio lo realiza tres días por semana y comienza a las 8:00 a.m. y termina a las 4:00 p.m. 

Rina, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para mejorar su negocio y para comprar concentrado para la crianza de cerdos. 

Rina, sueña con poder construir su propia casa, porque donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
22-year-old Rina only studied until the sixth grade before she could no longer continue going to school. She is a single mother, and her husband left her after finding out that she was pregnant. She lives only with her mother and her nephew.

Since she was 10 years old, Rina has worked growing maize and beans. She learned to do this thanks to her mother, as her father passed away when she was very young. Two years ago she began to sell clothing because a lack of money forced her to look for other means of generating income for her family. She sells clothing three days each week, beginning at 8:00 a.m. and ending at 4:00 p.m.

Rina needs the loan to buy clothing to improve her business and to buy feed for raising pigs.

Rina dreams of being able to build her own house, because her home now belongs to her mother.

loans.use: to buy clothing to improve her business and to buy feed for raising pigs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling at retail at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of opening a salon business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase a stock of cosmetics, including hair chemicals, sprays, lotions, braids and creams to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cosmetics, including hair chemicals, sprays, lotions, braids and creams to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a maize farmer from Nakaura village. As a Babban Gona member, Anthony is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Anthony would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Anthony can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Anthony no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Anthony hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rahim  Khatoon

texts.en:
Rahim Khatoon is 47 years old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 2 children.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Abdulsamadu

texts.en:
Abdulsamadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulsamadu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdulsamadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abdulsamadu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abdulsamadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 48-year-old lady, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and has successfully undergone enterprise development and financial management training.

She does farming of maize, beans, and bananas, and dairy farming, and majorly avocado farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy avocado seedlings and fertilizer. This will increase her avocado yield; hence she will have more income to pay education fees for her children and buy clothing for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy avocado seedlings and fertilizer; hence she will have more yields and income to pay education fees and buy clothing for her family.

loans.name: Silent Power Group

texts.en:
Making anything a success rests upon an individual’s commitment and passion towards what they are doing. Selina of the Silent power group is one of the people investing her efforts in things she is passionate about. She is a cross border trader to Zambia, South Africa, and Mozambique. Selina specialises in selling second-hand clothing. She sells at one of Harare’s busiest markets called “Mupedzanhamo,” which means the end of poverty.

Selina knows and believes that in business, competition means survival of the fittest. Although she is a very regular border crosser, crossing to neighbouring countries as much as three times a month, the stiff competition means that she should always have readily available stock and at different points of sale. It was at this point that Selina decided to open two more stands where she can sell her goods.

Selina has three people working for her and her business has grown. Having three market stalls meant that Selina had to ensure that they were adequately stocked to meet every customer's need. The major problem that she was now facing in her business was the lack of capital to restock more products to cater for her three tables.

Selina and her fellow group member, who is also a close business associate, joined Thrive after she saw an advert on television. They both saw it as an opportunity to grow their businesses and receive the relevant training.

Selina has been attending trainings that are offered at Thrive where she has learnt how to manage her business better than she used to. She is now able to keep and prepare her business financial records and track whether or not she is making a profit. She has also increased her knowledge in marketing clothes and can now make informed decisions on managing her business capital.

Through a loan from Thrive, Selina hopes to reach her business’s full capacity by restocking goods so she can meet her ever-increasing demand. Restocking more clothes for sale will also help her to boost her profits from the business.

loans.use: to reach her business’s full capacity by restocking goods so she can meet her ever-increasing demand.

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en: As a farmer generation, Sokea lives with wife and 4 children continues his family business. He is a hard working farmer. He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming. He puts all his effort in order to make his family live in better condition. However, his current power won’t make him achieve his goal. It is a money and time consuming. Sokea has to go to charge battery every 2 or 3 days. After he finds out that solar energy is the source he needs, he decided to apply for KIVA loan to pay for good quality solar home systems. He believes solar home system can reduce his burden and make him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Roleat Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear Di

loans.name: Kwinengane Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Damaris. She is 48 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She is a member of Kwinengane SHG group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management trainings.

She does poultry farming. She is borrowing her first Kiva loan to add poultry stock and buy poultry feed. She says this will enable her to increase her egg production; hence she will have more income to cater for her family’s basic needs such as food and clothing.

All members in this group are happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support, and promise to repay on time.

loans.use: to add poultry stock and buy poultry feed; hence have increased egg production and income to cater for her family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 25 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 10 años de edad, al que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante. Ella es una mujer muy admirable, que se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace 5 años. Ángela desea construir un corredor en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Angela is 25 years old and lives with her life partner and her 10-year-old son. She has painstakingly managed to advance herself. She is a very admirable woman, who has worked providing housekeeping services for the past 5 years. Angela wishes to construct a hallway in her home and is applying for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, stones, gravel, bricks, and iron to build the hallway.

loans.use: to buy: cement, stones, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 22 years old. He is married with one child.

He has had a retail shop business for two years. He will be using the loan to purchase more stock for his shop.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his child and to repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to improve the living standard of his family and to live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Kawendo Self Help Group

texts.en: Rose is sixty-one years old, married and the mother of eight children. She is a member of Kawendo Self Help Group and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to get training on enterprise development and financial management. She operates a grocery store and raises dairy goats, and is requesting this loan from Kiva to buy more dairy goats to raise. By producing more milk, she will be able to increase her income and provide her family with a better life and better medical care. Rose is happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: to buy more dairy goats.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a Babban Gona member, Hajara is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hajara can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later in in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hajara no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hajara hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mayra Esperanza

texts.es:
Mayra, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus recursos económicos no alcanzaban para seguir con la escuela, actualmente está separada, tiene tres hijos pero solo uno vive con ella, porque los otros dos ya están acompañados . 

Mayra, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace 4 años aproximadamente, esta tienda se la dejaron sus padres para que ella la administrara, pero además de eso ella también siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz a una distancia de 20 minutos de su casa.                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Mayra, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado para repasto.                     

Mayra, sueña con mejorar su casa para tenerlas más comodas.
texts.en:
47-year-old Mayra went to school until the third grade. She could not continue her studies because her economic resources did not allow her to continue going to school. She is now separated and has three children, but only lives with one because the other two are married.

Mayra has had a small store in her house for approximately the past 4 years. Her parents left her this store to run. She also grows 7,000 square meters of maize located at a distance of 20 minutes from her house. 

Mayra requires the loan to buy livestock to pasture land.

Mayra dreams of improving her home to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy livestock to pasture land.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand and has undergone training on enterprise development and financial management.

Catherine is a poultry farmer. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more chickens and repair her poultry house. The loan will enable her get more eggs and more income, which she will use to her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry stock and repair poultry house

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer from Duna village. As a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Hannatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing.

As a Babban Gona member Hannatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize, at a premium of up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hannatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land, Hannatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Assegai Crew Group

texts.en: Two years ago, Lilian lost her husband and now says that, “death robbed me of everything”. She has one child, who is in secondary school, and is now the family's sole breadwinner. After being left to fend for her only child, Lillian held on to hope and her motto is to, “pain ends!”  She is on the far left in the photo, and has been motivated by members of the Assegai Crew, who have been pillars of strength for her. The group gets its name from popular Zimbabwe dancers, who continued to dance even after the death of some key members. Lilian spent two years of inactivity after her husband’s death but friends are always friends, they found a basic job for her to become maid so that she could work in Botswana. Regardless of the shame, jeering and humiliation associated with the profession, she worked tirelessly, and after some months returned to Zimbabwe to open a shop in her town of Chitungwiza. Lilian wants a loan from a Thrive so that she can buy more groceries to sell and earn enough money to take care of her mother and child. Their quality of life has greatly improved. Lilian was also happy to receive financial training from Thrive, which helped her to make good borrowing decisions.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en:
Elxan is 58 years old and he is refugee from Bilasuvar region. He is married and has a large family. He is the only one working in the family and is a hard-working man. He is trying to earn enough income by being a farmer who raises cattle and sheep. This way he takes care of family's needs. He is very energetic and passionate about his job. There are many people in the local market who respect Elxan for his honesty and right principles over doing business. He has a small shop where he brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market there aren't many people who can provide the real natural meat. That's why people like buying from Elxan.

Due to growing demand in the market because of peoples' preference to traditional food like kufta, bozbash which consist of mutton, beef, Elxan is planning to expand. Currently he needs 1200 AZN loan to buy 3 calves. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi, 25, is a married mother of four. Three years ago, she decided to start her own home-based business to support her husband in covering their family's needs.

Hanadi is working hard to develop her business, since her acquired income, combined with her husband's, is barely enough to cover her family's increasing living needs.

For this reason, she is requesting a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise with a special, new winter collection.

Hanadi is working hard to open her own separate clothes-selling shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special, new winter collection.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 8 years 5 years old. He has had a profitable farming business for 15 years and is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. His goal is to increase his farm's output and earn enough money to educate his children, buy food for his family and expand his farming business. His goals for the future are to have a larger farm and add dairy cows because this will mean more income and an improved life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is married and has three children. The elder works at the kindergarten as a psychologist, his second child is a student, and the smallest is school-aged. He lives in the frontier village Achajur of Tavush region. His parents, who are pensioners, live with him. His wife is unemployed; she manages to take care of the family and house and helps Arsen with their farm. 

Arsen has cows, calves, pigs, and chickens. He also has a large orchard where he plants apples, nuts, and persimmons. His vineyard is also rich. Arsen  has no other source of income for his family except the farm and he does his best to develop it. From his farm, Arsen sells milk, macun (a national dairy product), butter, cheese, meat, eggs, and his orchard harvest.  

Recently Arsen started to go to Russian Federation for a job abroad but this is not stable way of earning for the family since the jobs abroad are mainly seasonal. He requested a loan for 700.000 Armenian drams, which he will use to purchase several pigs and fodder for all his farm cattle. He will also use the loan to do some work in his vineyard in order to prepare it for the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase several pigs and fodder for his farm cattle and to do some work in his vineyard to prepare it for winter months

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel with his two children and his wife (she works as a baker) lives in the frontier Aygehovit village of Tavush region. Samvel used to do some wood processing works in his own workshop but now he is only farming. In his farm he has cows, pigs and chickens.

Samvel sells from his farm milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs. Samvel has plans of developing swine breeding in his farm, but he has very little place for more cattle. He is also engaged in agricultural works and he manages to have very sweet harvest of persimmon and figs.

Samvel is happy with his family in a cute farm that brings income and also provides fresh products for his family. This loan Samvel asks as he decided to build a barn bigger and in very near future he will make purchase of more pigs and start swine breeding in his farm.

loans.use: to build a barn bigger and in very near future he will make purchase of more pigs and start swine breeding in his farm

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is 28 years old and she is married and has three children. She has a home carpentry business to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $ 1.500.00. She will buy wood boards, wood beams, wood glue, chisels, nails and other materials. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy wood boards, wood beams, wood glue, chisels, nails and other materials.

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en:
Alhasan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhasan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhasan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhasan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Alhasan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhasan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Chidau village. As a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization, Musa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Musa can store his maize and sell it in the future, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married and the mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 and has undergone training in enterprise development and financial management. She earns a living by making potato chips and farming vegetables. She is requesting this Kiva loan to buy chairs and tables to expand her potato chip business. This furniture will allow her attract more customers and earn more income to use to provide food for her family and pay school fees for her children. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her business.

loans.name: Zingatia Mazingira Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Theresiah. She is 25 years old, married and blessed with four children. She is a member of Zingatia Mazingira group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management.

She operates a salon and a clothing selling business. She is taking a Kiva loan to expand her clothing selling business by adding more stock to her enterprise.This will enable her meet her customer’s demands hence more income to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.
Theresiah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to add stock to her clothing selling business and meet customer's demands

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en: Nasibakhon is a bright and capable girl. Just now she is studying at the National Medical University. She likes to read books. Her favorite subjects are chemistry, biology and history. She participates in a lot of circles. She is unmarried .She is studying very hard. She is very kind and responsible. She always wants to help someone who needs help.  She intends to be the best specialist. She must pay a contract to the University. She is taking a loan for the second time. Her parents don’t work anywhere.  During the last four years, she reached a lot of her aims. She needs money. She is asking for a loan of 4,200 Somoni for this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Pisith

texts.en: A fisherman in the river near his house, Pisith,  44 years old, is a father of three children, one married.The woman who stands near Pisith is his wife.They can only make 15 USD per day to support their family. Pisith resides in a rural area of Kien Svay, Kandal Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in this career for more than 10 years now. Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan, since it will promote his health, the environment, and his living standard. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Ac

texts.en:
Ac is a 53-year-old man who lives in Carles, Iloilo with his family. He has four children; three children and one-school-aged child. He raised his family by doing the hog raising business. He has been doing this for more ten years.

Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP15000 to buy additional piglets to raised and feed as well. Other part of his loan is for his motorcycle maintenance. In the future, he wants to improve and expand his business for the sustainability of his family. Additionally, he dreams for his children to have stable jobs someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed also motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim is a 24 year-old Lebanese single woman living with her mother. Her mother represents the main income source and as for her, she is focusing on her study. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his university fees. In the future, she is planning to take more loan to ensure a great educational path, to be able to work at a proper company to gain good experience in the field.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 52 years old, married and has three children.

Perlita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Perlita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a married woman. She is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
Berlinda, who is in her early 40s, is a single parent with a child. She has been a trader for 12 years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will Berlinda's 5th loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to increase her clothing stock and renovated her shop. She has managed to pay back all of his loans successfully. She is really doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their Agape group. She used the profit to take care of her child, repay the loan, reinvest in her business and cover her household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of clothing and perfume for customer satisfaction. Her dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Berlinda will share this loan with her loan group Agape which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes and perfume for customer satisfaction.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en: Mayis is 46 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. He used to do different types of work but farming has been always his main activity. Today he is has a farm where he raises cows, calves, a bull, sheep and chickens. He also grows potatoes, and is happy because he can both use and sell what he grows. He sells his farm’s milk, meat, eggs and potatoes at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Mayis is married and has two daughters. His wife works as a baker. He is requesting a loan for 690,000 Armenian drams to buy a cow and also fodder for his herd.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for his herd.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Haruna can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Angela who is in her mid 40's, is married with three schooling children. She has been running three projects, a tailor, decorator who decorates on functions occasions and run's a catering business. She has been in her business for 7 years. She works from 9 am to 8 pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Angela's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her sewing products, buying latest decoration materials and started catering business. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her Loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their Group which is doing fine. She use the profit to pay for school fees, to repay loan, bought dishes for the catering business, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy sewing products, to buy new materials for decoration and to buy more catering equipment. She dreams to expand her business by opening a cafe.

Angela will share this loan with her loan group Mbogo,which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing products, to buy new materials for decoration and to buy more catering equipment

loans.name: Miriam Carolina

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven de veintidós años muy carismática, que ha tenido que aprender a valerse por sí misma, sus padres migraron fuera del país para mejorar su calidad de vida, situación que la llevo a emprender un negocio de venta de ropa, cosméticos y artículos para el hogar de forma ambulante y así comenzar a generar un ingreso que contribuyera a su desarrollo. Ella confiesa no le ha sido fácil pero sus ganas de convertirse en una gran comercianta ha hecho que ella no se dé por vencida. 
Esta temporada significa crecimiento para el negocio de Miriam, por eso ella ha soliticitado a Kiva junto a MiCrédito un préstamo que le permita comprar maquillaje, ropa para hombres y mujeres, sandalias para niñas, artículos para el hogar, entre otros productos que sus clientela busca en las fiestas navideñas. En un futuro ella espera poder abrir una tienda en un local situado en algún centro de compra de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Miriam is a young woman, 22 years of age, who is very charismatic. She has had to learn to value herself on her own. Her parents migrated outside the country to improve her quality of life. This situation led her to start a business selling in the streets clothing, cosmetics, and articles for the home. Thus, she began to generate income to contribute to her own development. Miriam confesses that it has not been easy but her urge to convert herself into a larger merchant has helped her to not accept defeat.

This season offers growth opportunities for Miriam's business. For that reason, she is applying to Kiva and MiCredito for a loan that will permit her to purchase makeup, clothing for men and women, sandals for girls, and articles for the home, among other products that her customers look for at the time of Christmas celebrations. In the future, Miriam hopes to be able to open a store in her neighborhood, preferably located in some market center in her city.

loans.use: buy makeup, clothing for men and women, sandals for girls, and articles for the home, among other products, to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra Fidelia

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer fuerte y esforzada, madre de seis hijos a los cuales ha logrado preparar y hacer adultos de bien. Desde hace treinta años ella empezó a incursionar en distintos negocios, en la actualidad posee uno de alquiler de sillas, mesas y manteles para eventos especiales, también por las tardes vende comida típica nicaragüense en su casa. 
Ella ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita fortalecer su negocio y comprar más sillas y mesas plásticas, dado que en esta temporada del año por las festividades su negocio tiene mucha demanda. En un futuro desea adquirir un camión en el cual pueda mover de una forma más segura sus artículos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a strong and hardworking woman. She is the mother of six children who she has managed to prepare well to be adults. Thirty years ago she started dabbling in different businesses, and currently runs a business renting chairs, tables and tablecloths for special events. She also sells traditional Nicaraguan food in her home in the afternoons.

She has come to Kiva together with MiCrédito so that they might provide her with a loan that would permit her to grow her business and buy more plastic chairs and tables, given that her business faces much demand this time of year due to the holidays.

In the future, she wishes to obtain a truck in which she can more securely move her items.

loans.use: to buy more plastic chairs and tables.

loans.name: Gouwend Manegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHRISTINE est responsable du groupe GOUWEND MANEGRE. Elle se porte bien. Elle est  mariée,  mère de 06 enfants.  Elle a un enfant  âgé de 24 ans  et  un enfant  âgé  de 04 ans. Elle a 01 enfant qui va  à l’école  et  03 personnes en charge.
Mme  est  dolotière (fabrication de la bière de  mil). Elle pratique cette  activité depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village de Yagma. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé,  elle  veut s’acheter 04 sacs de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo (bière de mil). 
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter d’autres sacs de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo.  Les  ambitions sont : pour l’affaire elle veut  produire beaucoup pour répondre aux nombreuses demandes de ses clients, pour la famille, elle veut améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine is the leader of the Gouwend Manegre Group. She is in good health. She is the married mother of six children. She has one child who is 24 years old and one child who is 4 years old. She has one child who goes to school and three people she cares for.

She is a brewer (making traditional millet beer). She has been working in this field for five years. She purchases supplies in the village of Yagma. Her customers are men and women.

With the money received, she would like to buy four bags of sprouted millet to prepare 'dolo' (millet beer).

She would like to use the profits to buy additional bags of sprouted millet to make 'dolo.' The goals are: for the business, she would like to produce more in order to meet the many requests of her customers; for the family, she would like to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four bags of sprouted millet to make 'dolo' (traditional beer made from millet).

loans.name: Rebeca Sarai

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 19 años de edad, dejo de estudiar porque tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar, está acompañada y vive únicamente con su esposo, el cual trabaja como transportista.

Rebeca, actualmente dejo de trabajar en una tienda y decidió colocar porque tiene experiencia para poder manejar un negocio como ese, ella abre el negocio todos los días desde muy temprano hasta la noche.

Rebeca, necesita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos como maíz, frijol y arroz, para vender en la tienda y de esa manera tendrá ingresos mejores.

Rebeca, sueña con tener una tienda más grande y tener su propia familia, pues sueña con tener 3 niños.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 19 years of age, left her studies because she had to start working. She lives only with her spouse, who works in transportation.

Rebecca recently stopped working in a store, and she decided to set one up because she has enough experience to manage a business like this one. She opens the business very early every day and works until the evening.

Rebeca needs this loan in order to purchase basic staple foods like corn, beans, and rice to sell in her store, which will help her earn better income. Rebeca dreams of having a larger store and having her own family with 3 children.

loans.use: to purchase basic staple foods like corn, beans, and rice to sell in her store, in order to earn better income.

loans.name: Khonzoda

texts.ru: Хонзода из города Турсунзаде. Она родилась в семье известных талантливых мастериц швея, чьи изделия покупаются и славятся во всей округе. Хонзода выросла среди  мастериц и получила все предпосылки для продолжения, сохранения и совершенствования этого вида ремесла. Шить и кроить Хонзода научилась у своей матери, а потому у свекрови совершенствовала своё мастерство. Изделия Хонзоды пользуются спросом среди местных жителей города.  У Хонзоды 2 дочерей, которых она также обучает этому ремеслу. Хонзода просит кредит для купли новой электронной швейной машинки. Она хочет ускорить процесс  своей работы. В дальнейшем Хонзода желает совершенствовать свои навыки шитья и передать эти знания своим дочерям.
texts.en:
Khonzoda is from the city of Tursun-zoda. She was born into a family well known for being talented sewers, whose products are bought and renowned throughout the region. Khonzoda grew up amongst experts and received all the knowledge needed to continue, preserve and improve in this kind of trade. Khonzoda learnt sewing and cutting from her mother, and improved her skills by learning from her mother-in-law.

Khonzoda's products are in demand from the city's local residents. Khonzoda has two daughters, to whom she is also teaching the trade. Khonzoda is asking for a loan to buy a new electric sewing machine. She wants to speed up her work. In the future, Khonzoda wishes to improve her sewing skills and pass this knowledge onto her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a new electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre que es una señora mayor de edad, ya que sus hijas son mayores de edad y viven solas. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una venta de zapatos. María desea continuar con las mejoras en su vivienda y para ello solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, y grava para instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda, con el crédito anterior logro instalar rejas en el corredor de su vivienda, lo que le permite brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her elderly mother, as her daughters are adults and live alone. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living providing her services in a shoe store. Maria wishes to continue with the improvements to her home and for this reason she is applying for a new loan through FUSAI to buy: floor tiles, cement, stones, and gravel to install tiled floors in her home. With her previous loan she was able to install a gate in the hallway of her home, which allows her to provide greater safety to her family.

loans.use: to buy: floor tiles, cement, stones, and gravel to install tiled floors in her home.

loans.name: Norlan Eduardo

texts.es:
Norlan es joven de veinticinco años de edad, que le apasiona la música y el mundo del entretenimiento. El hace un par de años decidió emprender su propio negocio de disco móvil para eventos especiales, gracias al apoyo de su papá que reside en el extranjero ha ido comprando algunas consolas, parlantes y luces. 
No obstante, este negocio tiene que estar en continua actualización, lo que es un desafío para Norlan, por eso él ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar nuevos equipos, como un amplificador, parlantes con luces integradas y un mezclador de discos. Su próxima meta es comprar un vehículo que le permita movilizarse con mayor rapidez para brindar un servicio de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Norlan, 25, is a young man who loves music and the entertainment world. A few years ago he decided to launch his own business as a DJ for special events. Thanks to support from his father, who lives abroad, he has been buying some consoles, speakers and lights.

Nevertheless, this business has to be continuously updated, which is a challenge for Norlan. That's why he has come to Kiva along with MiCredito to get a loan which will allow him to purchase new equipment, such as an amplifier, speakers with integrated lights and a DJ controller. His next goal is to buy a vehicle which will enable him to get around faster, to offer a higher quality service.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment, such as an amplifier, speakers with integrated lights and a DJ controller.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is 42 years old IDP from Bilasuvar region. He is married and together with his wife he grows some vegetables and fruits. Fazil with support of his spouse is running quite a successful farming business. He has more than 5 years of experience. He relies for his managing the farm on his wife's support. They support each other very well. Fazil is running the farm with great passion and love, because he wants to take care of his old parents, wife and a small kid. Fazil sells fresh meat in the local market.

In Azerbaijan there is a great demands for meat because it is used in traditional dishes like dolma, bozbash and also the fruit for after dinner deserts. He is currently planning to expand the business. He requires 1200 AZN to buy 3 calves. He hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Meshak

texts.en: Meshack is 30 years old, married to Pauline and blessed with three children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for four years. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and will be used to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle and keep it in good condition.  He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income. He will use the income to pay school fees for his children. His future hopes and dreams are to own a vehicle for transport business to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle and keep it in good condition

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a thirty years old, married and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise development and financial management.
She operates a shop. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more beverages, sugar, flour and rice to increase her sales. She says this will consequently increase her income which will enable her provide food and clothing for her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add stock to her shop by buying things like flour, beverages, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Big-Boy

texts.en:
Big-Boy is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Big-Boy has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Big-Boy would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Big-Boy can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Big-Boy will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Big-Boy is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sandra Teofila

texts.es: La señora Sandra de 35 de edad, soltera, tiene una hija dependiente de sus ingresos, se dedica al expendio de comida desde hace 4 años, vende los días de feria en el mercado triangular de la ciudad de Cochabamba, concurre a estos mercado los días Miércoles y Sábados, de esta manera genera sus ingresos, la señora es una persona muy responsable con muchas ganas de superarse, el motivo de la presente solicitud de ayuda económica es que le hace falta comprar un frigorífico y ollas exclusivamente para la conservación de los insumos que ocupa para la preparación de comida para la venta y de esta manera expandir su producto en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba y generar mejores ingresos ya que cuenta con mucha demanda de comensales, de esta manera satisfacer sus necesidades y poder sobre salir adelante y mejorar su vida económica y social la de la señora y su hija ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old, single and has one daughter who is dependent on her earnings. She has run a small food shop for the past 4 years. She sells food on market days in the triangular market in the city of Cochabamba. These markets come together Wednesdays and Saturdays, and in this way Sandra earns her living. 

She is a very responsible person with a great desire to better herself. Her reason for applying for this loan is to purchase a refrigerator and pots to preserve the supplies used for making the food for sale, and in this way expand her products to the different markets in the city of Cochabamba and earn more income. Since she has much demand from diners, in this way she will be able to satisfy their needs and be successful to improve her economic and social life, as well as that of her mother and her daughter since she is a single mother.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator and pots.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace 3 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado mucicipal y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre y su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fardos de ropa para poder continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 22 years old and lives in a zone of high risk, has been selling second-hand clothing for three years. His business is located in the municipal market and he has many customers. With what he obtains from his sales, he manages to pay some of his household expenses. The young man lives in his own house with his mother and his life companion.

He is applying for a loan to purchase bundles of clothing to be able to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman mother of one child. She cooperates with her husband to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses; she owns a toy shop in her town for 5 years, and her husband works as a nurse in a hospital.

Today, Hadia is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase merchandise for her toy shop in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to ameliorate her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her toy shop in order to improve it.

loans.name: Amparito Del Carmen

texts.es: Amparito es una mujer de 52 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus nietos, uno de 10 y uno de 4 años de edad, quien estudian en una escuela gratuita, Su nieta de dos años de edad permanece con  su abuelita ya que su mama depende de un trabajo , Amparito es alegre y le gusta mucho atender a sus clientes en la pequeña papeleria que inicio desde hace 10 años,  hoy necesita el dinero para comprar mercaderìa, papel, fundas,regalos navideños,tarjetas etc, generaría mayores ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas, ella aspira incrementar su negocio.
texts.en: Amparito is a 52-year-old woman who is single and has a small paper store in her neighborhood. She lives with her grandsons, 4 and 10 years old, who study in a free public school. Her two year old granddaughter stays with her grandmother since his mother depends on a job, Amparito is cheerful and loves to serve her customers in the small stationery store she started 10 years ago. Now she needs the money to buy goods, paper bags, Christmas gifts, cards etc, generate higher revenues to meet the basic needs of her family and aims to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations, gifts and wrapping

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre que se esfuerza y persevera por sus sueños, sus años de experiencia lo tiene obteniendo buenas cosechas, el con su crédito compro sus semillas he insumos y su cultivo realizo, afortunadamente le fue muy bien pues una buena cosecha obtuvo y en el mercado regional lo vendió, los préstamos han sido esenciales en la vida de Juan pues le han cambiado la vida por esa razón el acude a un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semilla de papa y fertilizantes como también pago de la mano de obra, pues  el necesita cultivar pero no tiene el capital suficiente. Juan confía plenamente en este crédito para poder seguir superándose con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a man who strives and perseveres for his dreams. His years of experience have him obtaining good harvests. With his loan, he bought his seeds and supplies, and he planted his crop. Fortunately things went very well for him, as he obtained a good harvest and sold it in the regional market.

The loans have been essential in Juan's life, as they have changed his life. For this reason he came to get a new loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers and also to pay for labor, as he needs to plant but doesn't have enough capital. Juan puts his full trust in this loan to be able to keep overcoming obstacles along with his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers and also to pay for labor

loans.name: Pia Doui Group

texts.fr: Mamou, est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont un scolarisé. le groupe de Mamou est à sa 3 ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et les remboursements se font à bonne dates. Cette brave dame est dans la restauration et cela fait 9 ans qu'elle exerce la restauration. Elle a besoin du crédit pour acheter du foyer à gaz à 100 000 f, 100 000 francs pour acheter du riz et de l'huile, 50 000 francs pour la boissons, enfin 50 000 francs pour le fonds de roulement. Pour faire marcher son activité, Mamou est très accueillante et très propre, propose des repas diversifiés à ses clients, ses repas ont un goût très particulier que ses clients aiment, par moment elle va même livré le repas aux clients à leurs lieu de services ou à domicile. Après ses ventes, les bénéfices de Mamou lui permettra d'épargner, de continuer son activité et aussi de faires les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mamou is the group's leader. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. The Mamou Group is on its third loan contract with ACFIME and repayments are made on time. This honest woman works in the restaurant business and has worked in restaurant business for nine years.

She needs this loan to buy a gas fireplace at 100,000 francs, 100,000 francs to buy rice and oil, 50,000 francs for drinks, and finally 50,000 francs for operating expenses. To make her business work, Mamou is very welcoming and very clean, provides a variety of meals for her customers. Her meals have a unique flavor which her customers like. Occasionally, she even delivers meals to her customers at their shops or homes.

After her sales, Mamou's profits will allow her to save, to continue her business, and also to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy a gas buy a gas fireplace (at 100,000 francs), rice and oil (at 100,000 francs), drinks (at 50,000 francs), and lastly 50,000 francs for operating expenses.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Aminu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 
Traditionally, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Aminu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Aminu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 
Aminu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Huguette

texts.fr: Huguette a 44 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a 4 enfants. Elle vend depuis plus de 12 ans des vêtements d'occasion. Grâce à cette activité, elle arrive à répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle fait une demande de microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Elle veut agrandir son commerce et pouvoir épargner pour les études de ses enfants.
texts.en: Huguette is 44 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has four children. For twelve years, she has been selling used clothing. Thanks to this business, she manages to respond to the needs of her children. She is asking for a micro-loan to increase her inventory. She wants to expand her commerce and save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis tiene 64 años de edad, es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y solo tiene 1 hijo.
