Aminu is a maize farmer from Dokantoro village. As a Babban Gona member, Aminu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Aminu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Aminu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Aminu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Murtala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Murtala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Murtala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from kadanya Biyar village. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Isiyaku can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isiyaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Isiyaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Makera village. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Iliya can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Iliya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Iliya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Felipa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Felipa es una mujer trabajadora de 52 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 15 años de edad a la que busca la manera de sacar adelante. Ella es una mujer tenaz que no se deja vencer por las dificultades y se dedica a prestar sus servicios como promotora de salud para sacar adelante a su familia. Felipa desea mejorar su vivienda cada día, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para construir un pasamano alrededor del corredor de su vivienda y evitar que el agua ingrese a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipa is a hardworking 52 year old woman who lives in her house along with her 15 year old daughter and is looking for a way to support her family. She is a tenacious woman who doesn't give up because of difficulties and makes her living offering her services as a health promoter to forge ahead with her family. 

Felipa wishes to improve her home every day, and that's why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to build a low wall around the patio to prevent water entering the house.

loans.use: to build a low wall around the patio of her home to prevent water entering the house.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Her parents both earn incomes while Nisrine doesn’t work and  is focusing on her studies. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her university fees. In the future, she is planning to take out more loans to ensure a great educational path.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Naziru

texts.en:
Naziru is a maize farmer from Bakutaje village. As a member of Babban Gona, Naziru is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Naziru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Naziru can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Naziru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shuaibu

texts.en:
Shuaibu is a maize farmer from Sarki Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Shuaibu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, five and a half times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Shuaibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shuaibu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Shuaibu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Musa can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Con 51 años de edad, Blanca reside en vivienda propia al lado de sus hijos quienes son su compañía en el diario vivir. Ella es madre soltera y para poder sacarlos adelante se esfuerza día con día en un humilde trabajo que ha obtenido dentro de una panadería, además en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de fruta, y gracias a ello logra mantener la economía de su vivienda. Blanca en busca de mejorar su condición de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en arena, cemento, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto habitación. De esta manera poder tener mayor espacio en su hogar y así también mejorar considerablemente su condición de vida. Además se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito anterior, ya que pudo invertir en el techo de su vivienda logrando tener una mayor tranquilidad junto con su familia.
texts.en:
At 51 years old, Blanca lives in her own house along with her children who are her companions in daily life. She is a single mother and to be able to get them ahead she makes an effort day by day with the humble work she obtained in a bakery. In her spare time she also sells fruit and thanks to this she manages to support the family's finances.

Blanca, looking to improve her living conditions has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, bricks and to pay for labor to construct a room. In this way she can have more space in her house and also improve her living conditions considerably. She is very grateful for her previous loan as she was able to invest in the roof of her house managing to have greater tranquility along with her family.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, bricks and pay for labor to construct a room.

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en:
Shirin is a 49-year-old refugee from Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He is a highly motivated farmer who's been able to get his business idea ahead through effort and dedication. He is taking care of his family. He helps his old parents who are retirees. Sometimes his parents come and support Shirin in the yard with farming activities.

For the last six years, and with the goal of generating more income, he has been doing farming activities like growing vegetables and fruits. He sells them in the local bazaar and to the clients in the neighbourhood. He is a very diligent and honest man. People know him as a trustworthy person. Shirin displays his products in a shop located in the bazaar close to his home.

He is now applying for 1200 AZN to expand his business activity. He needs to buy a motor for generating water to his farm. His area is in an arid zone and the water channel is far from his place. He needs the engine to generate water from the tanks. With the growing demand for fruits and vegetables, he needs to expand as well. He will uses the funds to buy a motor to get water.

loans.use: to buy a motor to get water.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya will now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price, at a premium up to 37% more than at harvest.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Yahaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members, and he would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Ilahe

texts.en:
Ilahe is 31 years old. She is IDP and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She is married. She is involved in raising cattle. She owns dozens of cows. She both uses them for milk and meat purposes. Ilahe is a very energetic and hardworking person. She knows that being a successful farmer in the rural area requires more dedication and expertise. For this end she does her best.

At this age she works tirelessly. Her energy and dedicated approach makes her different and more preferable. She fattens the calves and sells their meat to many clients in the local bazaar. People prefer meat for the traditional foods like kebabs, kufta, etc. Currently she is planning to expand her business. Ilahe wants to buy three calves. In order to buy these calves she needs a 1900 AZN loan. Kiva lenders should support her.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and four siblings who are still studying. His father is the main income source. He works as an officer in the Lebanese security forces with the aim of ensuring them a full life. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school stationery and to buy a school bag. He is very ambitious and he intends to study harder to obtain high grades.

loans.use: to pay for the school stationery and to buy a school bag.

loans.name: Doha

texts.en:
Doha is a 21-year-old single woman living with her parents and a sibling. Her father and mother work hard; they are determined to improve their family’s way of living. As for Doha, she is focused on school.

Today, with the aim to pay her educational fees and her sibling's school registration fee, Doha is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy. Doha's goal is to achieve a suitable, higher-level education and to help her father with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay her educational fees and her sibling's school registration fee.

loans.name: Isavary

texts.en:
Isavary is 26 years old. She is married with one child. She does farming and also has a retail business which she has been running for three years. She will be using the loan to buy cereals such as maize, beans, wheat, and millet to sell and hopes this will enable her to make more profits to provide food for her family and build a bigger cereal shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as maize, beans, wheat, and millet to sell and she hopes this will enable her to make more profits to provide food for her family.

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru:
Кобилчон  молодой жизнерадостный парень 32 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Кобилчон живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Все соседи относятся к нему хорошо, так как он проявляет себя как отзывчивый и добрый человек, который всегда готов помочь тому, кто нуждается в помощи. 
С детства Кобилчон  помогал своему отцу в его деле, его отец имел ресторанный бизнес. Так Кобилчон и сам научился этому делу от своего отца. Вот уже как 5 лет он занимается этим делом. У него есть своя чайхана. он принимает заказы на мероприятия, от этой работы и получает хороший стабильный доход. Клиенты у Кобилчона есть в разное время года. Кобилчон имеет очень много клиентов, которые довольны обслуживанием в его чайхане. 
В данный момент Кобилчон хочет отремонтировать свою чайхану, и для этого ему нужны денежные средства.
Он заранее благодарить «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.
texts.en:
Kobiljon is a young 32-year-old man full of joie de vivre. He is married and has four children. Kobiljon lives with his family in a small village. All his neighbours get along well with him, since he presents himself as a caring and kind person who is always ready to help anyone in need. 

From his childhood, Kobiljon has helped his father with his business. His father had a restaurant business. Thus Kobiljon also learned about this business from his father. He has been working in this business for five years. He has a small teahouse. He takes orders for events, and he receives a good stable income from this job. Kolbijon has clients at various times of the year. Kobiljon has many clients who are satisfied with his teahouse's service. 

Currently Kobiljon wants to renovate his teahouse, and he needs funds for this. He thanks Arvand in advance for the given support, and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to renovate his teahouse

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ahmad is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ahmad would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ahmad will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ahmad now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 31-year-old married mother of four. Three years ago she started her own women's clothes and perfume selling business to support her beloved husband in earning their living, and to provide their children with the best education.

Faten is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the newly released winter collection.

This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a paying back history in good standing. Her previous loan was invested in the same purpose, and she is hoping that through future loans, she will be able to diversify her products and introduce her customers to newly released products such as women's shoes.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a newly released winter collection.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents and a sibling. Her father is the main income source in the family. Ahlam is focused on school.

Today, Ahlam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her education fees for the new school year. She said that she is very happy. Her goal is to achieve a suitable, higher-level education and to help her father with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay her education fees

loans.name: Jaron Steven

texts.es:
Jaron acaba de alcanzar la mayoría de edad en su país, edad cuando la mayoría de jóvenes están saliendo de secundaria, sin embargo, este visionario de la vida profesional decidió estudiar una carrera técnica en mercadotecnia mientras estaba en secundaria. Él lo miró como una oportunidad para prepararse para la universidad y así poder trabajar en algo al finalizar su escuela. 
Afortunadamente Jaron cuenta con el apoyo de su papá, quien trabaja en un call center y lo ha sido su guía todo el tiempo. Ahora este joven está a punto de finalizar sus estudios, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de la promoción. Esto le permitirá coronar esta etapa de su vida y seguir avanzando en este mundo con oportunidades. En sus planes está entrar a la universidad y seguir enriqueciéndose de conocimientos.
texts.en:
Jaron has just reached the age of majority in his country, the age when the majority of youth are graduating Secondary school. This visionary of the professional world decided to study a technical course in marketing while he was in Secondary school. He views it as an opportunity to prepare for university and to be able to work in something when he is finished his schooling.

Fortunately Jaron has the support of his father. He works in a call center and has been his guide all this time. Now this youth is on the point of completing his studies so he is requesting a loan to pay for the costs of graduating. This will allow him to crown this stage of his life and continue to advance in the world with opportunities. Amongst his plans is to enter university and continue to expand his knowledge.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of his graduation.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Ali has been running a school for two years now. He is an independent man who has taken his business to a high level. Ali has been looking after his school, all the departments, himself.

He now wants to introduce higher levels of education and is working hard to take it to this level. Therefore Ali has applied for the loan amount so as to help him boost his business and also to facilitate his students, so that they do not have to go somewhere else while progressing upwards in education.

Ali appreciates the Kiva platform and is impressed by the terms. He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan as well, as it will help him with his business.

loans.use: invest in the improvement of his school business.

loans.name: Irine's Group

texts.en:
Irine is 44 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Irine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Irine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Irine's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
Siham is a divorced 28-year-old lady who has no one to comfort her and be with her at her lonely ‎times except her project. She always wanted to have kids, but as she said, she was lucky not have ‎them, especially that she is divorced now. ‎

Siham decided to concentrate on empowering herself by improving her project, which is a small ‎shop where she sells home products and accessories, and has a section for children's toys. Her shop is in a popular ‎neighborhood.

Now she is applying for a loan to support her shop with more goods and accessories and to add more home and kitchen products. ‎

loans.use: to support her shop with more goods and ‎accessories and to add more home and kitchen products.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a maize farmer from Babbarika village. As a Babban Gona member, Hamisu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior farming inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hamisu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hamisu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hamisu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Idris has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Idris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Idris can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Idris will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Idris is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Nura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nura would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Nura can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Nura will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Nura is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yohanna can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yohanna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Yohanna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 50 years old mother for two daughters and four sons, her husband has retired from the ‎military and is receiving his pension that is not enough to support the family. This lead Khitam to ‎use her experience that she got from her mother in sewing and turn it into a small home project. ‎

Khitam started small doing basic tailoring work and then expanded to find out that she can master ‎tailoring curtains and bed mattresses. Now she is requesting a loan in order to buy more fabrics and ‎also another sewing machine, as she is planning to expand and add someone to help her preparing ‎her orders.‎

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and ‎also another sewing machine so as to employ someone else

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Mme ALIMATA  est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a un enfant  âgé de 25 ans et un enfant  âgé de 04 ans. Elle a  04 enfants qui  vont à l’école et  05 personnes en charges.
Elle  vend de la friperie  depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne en Italie. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  03 barriques d’habits pour vendre avec ses clients.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter d’autres friperies pour vendre dans son magasin. Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire, elle veut  acheter beaucoup pour attirer plus de clients, pour la famille, elle veut payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alimata is married and a mother of 4 children between the ages of 25 and 4 years old. Four children are in school and she has five people under her care.

She has been selling second-hand cloths for 5 years. She resupplies in Italy. Her clients are men, women, and their children.

With the loan money, she plans on buy three barrels of cloths to sell to her clients.

She wants to use the profits from the loan to buy other cloths to sell in her store. Her business goals are to buy more to attract more clients. For her family, she wants to pay for her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy three barrels of cloths to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a widow. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home to meet their day-to-day expenses. Khalida is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business.

Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time. She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Alizeta

texts.fr:
Mme ALIZETA  est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a un enfant  âgé de 28 ans et un enfant  âgé de 08 ans.  Elle a 03 enfants  qui vont à l’école et  03 personnes en charges.
Elle vend du savon  liquide. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les  boutiques de son quartier. Ses clients sont les salariés.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 03 plats de sel, 2 bidons de parfum, 20 litres de tansagex pour la fabrication du savon liquide.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter d’autres produits pour vendre avec ses clients. Les ambitisons sont : pour l’affaire,  elle veut augmenter ses produits pour attirer plus de clients, pour la famille, elle veut  aider  son mari avec la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alizeta is married and a mother of four children. One child is 28 years old and another is 8 years old. Three of her children are in school and under her care.

She sells liquid soap. She has been doing this business for 7 years. She resupplies in the shops around her neighborhood. Her clients are salaried workers.

WIth the money from the loan, she plans to buy 3 plates of salt, 2 containers of perfume, and 20 liters of tansagex, for soap making.

She wants to use the profits from the loan to buy other products to sell to her clients. Her goals for her business are to increase her products to attract more clients. For her family, she wants to help her husband with their children's tuition payments.

loans.use: to buy 3 plates of salt, 2 containers of perfume, and 20 liters of tansagex (for soap making).

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La carrera de medicina es la pasión de Danelia, una joven de 26 años de edad, que ama ayudar a los demás. Razón por la cual decidió convertirse en médico general, sin embargo, el alto costo que significaba estudiar esta carrera universitaria la inspiró a emprender el negocio de la venta de prendas de acero, para luego complementarla con ropa usada y así poder pagar sus estudios.
Ahora Danelia ya lleva seis años en este negocio, está casada, tiene una bebé de seis meses y trabaja como médica en un hospital privado. No obstante, ella desea invertir más en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar collares, anillos, aretes de acero y ropa de segunda mano, pues considera que entre más invierte, más crece económicamente y así podrá asegurar el futuro de su bebé. En un futuro ella suela con crear más negocios y por qué no en la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Danelia’s passion is a medical career. She’s a young twenty-six year old woman who loves to help others; that’s why she decided to become a general practitioner. But the high cost of studying this at university inspired her to start a business selling steel items. She would sell them alongside used clothing and then be able to pay for her studies.

Now Danelia has already spent six years in this business, is married, has a six-month-old baby, and works as a doctor in a private hospital. However, she wants to invest more in her business. That’s why she’s asking for a loan to buy stainless steel necklaces, rings, earrings, and second-hand clothing. She believes that the more she invests, the more it will grow economically; this way, she’ll be able to secure her baby’s future. In the future, she dreams of starting more businesses, perhaps selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy stainless steel necklaces, rings, earrings, and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
De joven, la agricultura, el arado y el riego eran las actividades que usualmente hacia Flor, una emprendedora que ahora tiene 47 años de edad  y que decidió trabajar en como comerciante de comida, coyolitos y verduras, donde ya lleva cuatro años y cuenta con  el apoyo de su esposo, quien es agricultor, y de una de sus dos hijas. 
Flor se siente muy segura en su trabajo actual, pues en esos años siente que ha obtenido buenos ingresos. Razón por la cual desea invertir en ello y solicita un préstamo para comprar coyolitos, carne, arroz, frijoles, tomate, lechuga, chiltoma, rábano, entre otras verduras. Ella considera que comprando al por mayor, podrá ahorrar más y obtener mayores ganancias. En un futuro desea invertir aún más en sus negocios y hacerlos crecer como una empresa que continúen sus hijas.
texts.en:
Since she was young Flor has worked in agriculture, performing duties like ploughing and watering. She is now a 47 year old entrepreneur who has decided to work as a food merchant selling a fruit called coyolito and vegetables. She has been doing this for 4 years and counts on the support of her spouse, who is an agricultural worker, and of one of her daughters. 

Flor feels very secure in her current work and feels she has obtained good income in these years. This is why she wishes to invest in the business and ask for a loan to purchase coyolitos (fruit), meat, rice, beans, tomatoes, lettuce, peppers, radishes among other vegetables. 

She wants to buy in larger quantities to save money and obtain better earnings. In the future she wants to invest even more in her businesses and make them grow into a business that her daughters can continue.

loans.use: to purchase coyolitos (fruit), meat, rice, beans, tomatoes, lettuce, peppers, radishes, among other vegetables.

loans.name: Junally

texts.en:
Junally is a 36-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has five children, ages 19, 18, 16, 14 and 11 years old.

She makes a living by selling food (snacks) to the community. She has been doing this for 18 years and is hoping to have more successful years to come to enhance their livelihood; while her husband is working hard in their farm, her husband is a farmer.

Junally uses her profit for children’s school allowances such as food, transportation expense and other basic needs. Now she is asking for a loan amount to buy food ingredients such as banana fruit, sugar, fried roll wrapper and cooking oil. Junally aims to improve her business for her children. She wants to have enough money to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as banana fruit, sugar, fried roll wrapper and cooking oil

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two adult children. She helps her husband earn a living by doing a hog-raising business. Her husband works hard as a “habal-habal” driver. A “habal-habal” is a motorcycle with extended seat. Thus, she wanted to improve this business for their future needs. But, with raising pigs, she needs a more capital to finance their feed. That is why she is in need of a loan, to sustain buying feed for her pigs and to buy additional piglets as well. Additionally, Letecia aims in the future to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 43 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of the cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Tahira has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Saadah

texts.en:
Saadah, a 56 years old widow who lives in one of the under privileged areas called Deiralla. She ‎works as a farmer in the area at day time, and after that she sells home products at her house, as ‎her retail project to have another supporting source of income. She is able to cover her daughter’s ‎educational fees that she was not able to do before.

Now Saadah is requesting a loan to ‎buy more home products and home accessories to sell as there are no such stores in their area.‎

loans.use: to ‎buy more home products and home accessories to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 35 years old and single with two children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Arlyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Arlyn has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Sak Wende Group

texts.fr: Salamata est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Le groupe de Salamata est à son 1er contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et promet de respecter les dates de remboursement afin d'avoir une bonne collaboration. Cette brave dame vend de diverses articles. Elle a besoin du prêt  pour acheter un sac de cabacourou à 37 500 f du spaguetti à 21 000 f, un carton et demi de mayonnaise à 34 500 et 7 000 f pour achat de légumes. Pour faire avancer son  activité, elle est très accueillante, respectueuse envers ses clients, après ses ventes, les bénéfices de Salamata lui permettra de continuer son activité, de faire de l'épargne et aussi faire les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en: Salamata is the leader of the group. She is married and has two children. Salamata's group is on it's first contract with ACFIME and promises to respect the loan payment dates in order to have a good working relationship. This brave woman sells diverse products. She needs a loan to buy a bag of soap at 37,500f, some pasta at 21,000f, a carton and a half of mayonnaise at 34,500 and a purchase of vegetables at 7000f. To increase her business, she is very welcoming and respectful toward her clients. After her sales, Salamata's profits will permit her to continue her business, to save, and to take care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a bag of soap at 37, 500f, some pasta at 21,000f, a box and a half of mayonnaise at 34,500f and 7,000f for a purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Amos is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amos would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Amos can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Amos no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Amos hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is maize farmer from Dogon Fako village. As a member of Babban Gona, Laazarus is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Laazarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Laazarus can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Laazarus is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
A 35-year-old Palestinian Refugee, and a married mother of of three. This is the hard working Khouloud, who lives in a Palestinian refugees camp, where eleven months ago she established her own clothes selling business in a good commercial region hoping that through this step she can develop her family's social and financial living.

Today, and since her newly established business needs an external financial support, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva;s field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special new released winter collection.
She was employed in a similar clothes selling business, where she managed to save her requested capital to start her current business.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special newly released winter collection.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a food stall business for the past three years, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of storage means in her business. She also sells firewood.  Her dream is to buy a fridge to be able to preserve her food in the near future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and firewood.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 60 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rose also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with three children whereby two of them attend school and one is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a food stall business for the past six years, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of storage means in her business. Her dream is to buy a fridge to be able to preserve her food in the near future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: By His Grace Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a single woman in her late 30s, married with a school-aged child. She has been a trader in the sales of cloth for 7 years and works from 6am to 4pm daily . She makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Agnes's 11th loan from ID-Ghana. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Agnes will share this loan with her loan group 'By his grace' which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock cloth items in her store.

loans.name: Yushau

texts.en:
Yushau is a maize farmer from Rago village. As a Babban Gona member, Yushau is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yushau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yushau can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yushau no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yushau hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Baturiya no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Aliyu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Aliyu plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Gambo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Gambo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Gambo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Gambo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Gambo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Busime A Group

texts.fr: Vumilia est une femme commercante, membre du groupe de crédits «Busime A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 2 sont encore petits. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires au marché de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 20 sacs d’haricots. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Vumilia is a businesswoman, a member of the group Busime A, and a client of the microfinance institution, Hekima. VUmilia is 34 years old, married, and a mother of 8 children, of whom 6 are in school now. She has been selling food products at the town market for 7 years.

She is going to resupply with 20 sacks of beans. She started her business with some capital she received in a loan. Her wish is to increase her credit, to educate and to feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of non bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to resupply with 20 sacks of beans.

loans.name: Mayzeen

texts.en:
Mayzeen lives in a rented house in Wihdat, Amman. She is a 59-year-old widow who works in a ‎tailoring business. She learned how to tailor when she was young but did not practice it till after ‎her husband passed away. She started her tailoring work because of the amount of debts and financial responsibilities she was ‎left with. ‎

At first Mayzeen started working in a nearby tailoring workshop to save up some transportation ‎money and to get more experience in the business. She also built a good relationship with the ‎people in the business as she was planning to have her own business after that. ‎

Later on she was able to buy a sewing machine and start working at home after her full-time job at ‎the workshop to make extra money until she could expand it more. Now as a step toward expanding, ‎Mayzeen is applying for a loan in order to buy more winter fabric to tailor winter clothes and outfits ‎to sell during this winter.‎

loans.use: to buy more winter fabric to tailor winter clothes and outfits ‎to sell during this winter.

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Obadiah is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Obadiah would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Obadiah will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% above the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land, Obadiah now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and he would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Duman

texts.en:
Duman is 23 years old and he is refugee from Bilasuvar region. He is married and has 1 son and 1 daughter. Duman's family is large family, because he also support his old parents and younger siblings. He is very hard-working in the family. He is trying to earn enough income by being a seller of carpets in a shop in market. This way he takes care of family's needs. He is very energetic and passionate about his job.

He is a well-known carpet seller who does great job in meeting customers' needs. He has a small shop where he brings carpets bought from wholesale in capital city and to sell in the market. In the local market there aren't many people who can provide the real natural carpets of good quality.

Due to growing demand in the market for carpets, such as for decorating purposes, he is planning to expand. Currently he needs 1200 AZN loan to buy new stock. He hope Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy new carpet stock.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer from Madarzai village. As a Babban Gona member, Sale is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Sale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Sale can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Sale hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kiedouane Gnin Group

texts.fr: Bibata est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont trois scolarisés. Elle vend des condiments dans son quartier et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter des condiment c'est à dire acheter du persil à 100 000 francs et aussi des feuilles de menthe à 50 000 francs. Dans le quartier il n' y a pas de marcher à côté ce qui fait que la vente de ses condiments marche bien en plus de cela, elle propose des condiments d qualité à ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura, un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a reçu le prêt trois fois et à rembourser à la bonne date à ACFIME.
texts.en: Bibata is married and a mother of five children, three of which are in school. She sells condiments in her neighborhood and she has been doing this business for 10 years. She need a loan to buy condiments, namely to buy parsley at 100,000 francs and mints leaves at 50,000frances. In the neighborhood, there isn't a market nearby, which makes her sales increase. In addition to that, she offers quality condiments to her clients. After the sales, she will have a profit that will allow her to save up, to take care of her family, and also to continue her business. She has received three loans, which she repaid on time at ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy parsley at 100,000 francs and also some mint leaves at 50,000 francs.

loans.name: Dukorerehamwe Group

texts.en:
Hakim is a 35 year old father of one child. He operates a retail shop which is run by his wife. The shop sells daily household use items that are bought by the community members.

He is a first time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance having applied for a loan facility of ugx500,000/= and the main purpose of the facility is to buy stock for the business. The retail business is his main source of income. This has enabled him to make some profits thus improving the family's standards of living.

He is so grateful for the support rendered to him by Kiva funders through Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. He has promised to meet his obligations.

loans.use: to boost his retail business.

loans.name: Malami

texts.en:
Malami is a maize farmer from Barau village. As a Babban Gona member, Malami is excited to have access to a trained Agronomist and superior inputs that will make it possible for him to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Malami had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Malami can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until later in the season when he can earn up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Malami no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Malami hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Heroina Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Heroína, ya que ellas se unieron para poder trabajar y ayudarse las unas a las otras y dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, se esfuerza siempre por sus seres queridos para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a las artesanías, hace croché en todas sus formas, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder salir adelante día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, agujas, bastidores y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus artesanías como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called "Heroína" as they got together to be able to work and help each other and provide their families with a better quality of living.

One of the members is Mirian. She is a very hard-working woman who always makes the effort to be able to provide a better quality of living for her loved ones. She works making crafts, making crochet in all it's forms and through her work has the means to get ahead day by day.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of thread, needles, frames and others. In this way she can continue with her crafts as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, frames and others.

loans.name: Fayyaz

texts.en:
Fayyaz is a 38 years old IDP from Bilasuvar region. He is married, living with his family consisting of 1 son and 2 daughters. He likes to help his old retired mother and father who are together living in refugee settlement. He has been repairing motors in his yard and he loves this job.

Fayyaz with his knowledge and skills earns livelihood to support his family. His wife is a teacher at kindergarten but helps him with great passion, such as cleaning the workshop. He has more than 5 years of experience. Fayyaz is running the workshop, because he wants to take care of his family. He also repairs lawn motors and other small engines.

In Azerbaijan there is a great demand for these masters, because many people are farmers and have different types of equipment which require services frequently. He is currently planning to expand the business. He requires 1200 AZN to buy new repairing tools and other motor parts. He hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy new tools and other motor parts for repairing small engines and machinery .

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He cooperates with his father to enhance their family’s financial situation. He struggles to work really hard and doesn’t hesitate to offer help whenever needed. Both men work both in the agriculture sector.

Currently, Haytham is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas, to pay his sister’s university fees. In the future, he plans to take additional loans to ensure a great educational path for his sister. He hopes that this will allow her to work at a proper company and gain good experience in her field.

loans.use: to pay his sister’s university fees.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 35 years old man from Kisumu, he supports one person and is married.

He has a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last 10 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 15000.

He has requested for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase more shop items.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items for his retail shop

loans.name: Munkaila

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ma. Alma

texts.en: Ma. Alma is a 45-year-old woman from the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a single woman who runs a sari-sari (variety) store. Ma. Alma describes her biggest business challenge is to have insufficient capital. This is the reason why she is requesting for a loan. She will buy grocery items such as sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies. She has been doing this for years to supports her family. Ma. Alma’s main goal in life is to have sufficient income to sustain everyday.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a mother of six children living in Swaimeh – Deirallah, which is considered one of the most ‎underprivileged areas in Jordan. Her husband works in the military and earns a small ‎income which lead her to find another income source to support their family. She started her project by ‎buying basic food items and snacks and selling them to the neighborhood’s kids and families. She is ‎happy that she is making even a small amount of money, but the feeling of ‎being a productive housewife has satisfied her.‎

Hanan is looking to expand her project. She has applied for a loan to purchase more food items such as rice, sugar, canned foods, etc. to serve not ‎only children, but their households as well. In addition, she wants to start selling detergents.

loans.use: to expand her project by adding more food items such as rice, sugar, canned food, etc. to serve households as well as children.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is maize farmer from Bakutaje village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abdullahi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Abdullahi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Salvador del Mundo está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
La Sra. Francisca es una humilde mujer, muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que a través de la venta de remedios naturales y venta de plantas que hace se gana la vida de una manera digna. Ella es muy sacrificada y poco a poco está mejorando sus condiciones de vida  con su sacrificio y con la ayuda de su grupo, por lo que cada día se esfuerza un poco más para ir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, como así también de plantas, de manera a poder seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo y esforzándose por crecer y salir adelante. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe siempre de poder ser útil a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Niño Salvador del Mundo is in the sixth cycle of its program with a committee of women who all work and help each other to get ahead.

Ms. Francisca is a humble, very hardworking, and self-sacrificing woman who through selling natural remedies and plants has made a good living. She’s very self-sacrificing, and little by little is improving her living conditions with her sacrifice and with the help of her group. That’s why every day she works a little harder to grow even more.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy natural remedies and plants to sell. In this way, she can continue investing in her business and work harder to grow and get ahead. She’s thankful for this opportunity to always be useful to her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies and plants to sell.

loans.name: Yahaya Dauda

texts.en:

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 45-year-old married woman living in a rented home with her kids and husband. Her husband ‎sells fruits and vegetables from his truck around their area. ‎Manal's husband, Ali, appears in the picture instead of Manal because she is a conservative woman. ‎

Ali used to work with his friend as a transporter. When their financial obligations and living ‎demands increased, Ali found that his income was not enough, so he started his own project ‎selling fruits and vegetables in front of his home. Eventually, he was able to buy a truck, using it to expand his sales area.
‎
Manal is now requesting a loan to support her husband in increasing his quantity of ‎fruits and vegetables. He will also use the money to do some maintenance on the truck before the winter becomes harder.‎

loans.use: to support her husband by increasing his quantity of ‎fruits and vegetables and paying for maintenance on the truck.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is the mother of a little child, and she is the owner of her house.

Eliza is in the dairy business. She learned with her mother a long time ago. Eliza sells milk to a private milk plant. She needs a loan to buy a dairy cow for her business.

She hopes you can help her because her farm is small, but she has big plans for the future.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Idris

Idris is maize farmer from Bakutaje village. As a member of Babban Gona, Idris is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

loans.name: Alegría Concepcion

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Alegría, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores e independientes. El esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 
Alegría es una mujer que de alguna u otra forma trata de ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos y gallinas criollas, ella compra los pollos cuando están pequeños los cría por un tiempo y luego entrega a comerciantes del lugar, lo mismo hace con las gallinas aunque estas mas las vende a vecinos, así mismo ella vende los huevos que ponen sus gallinas con lo cual se gana algo extra, por lo general las gallinas las tiene para esto ya que al vender los huevos gana y siempre sigue ganando, ella también parte del los créditos se los da a su marido, él se dedica a la  agricultura y requiere en esta ocasión para arreglos en las tierras que espera sembrar en esta época invernal que se avecina.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y para pago de sueldos en los trabajos de  arreglo de las tierras de cultivo. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con salud para trabajar.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro meets every 15 days in the city of 30 de Septiembre located in the Rocafuerte canton. The area is known throughout the country for the delicious sweets that the people there make.

Alegría, who is 66 years old, lives in this area. She is married and from this relationship, she has four children who are independent adults. Her husband makes his living in agriculture. Alegría is a woman who, in one way or another, tries to help her husband get ahead.

She has small farm where she raises free range chickens and hens. She buys the chickens when they are small and raises them for a time and afterward she takes them to stores in the area. She does the same with the hens, however, she sells them to her neighbors. She also sells the eggs that the hens lay which makes her some extra income. In general, she keeps the hens for this purpose because she can always make an income from the eggs they lay.

She will also give some of the loan to her husband. He makes a living in agriculture and right now he needs it to fix up his land that he wants to sow during this winter season that is approaching.

This loan will be used to by chickens, their feed, and to pay salaries for the preparation work on the farmland.

She has been in the Grupo De Crédito since it started and she likes it because of the help the institution offers. Her dream is to continue her good health so she can work.

loans.use: to buy chickens and their feed and to pay salaries.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is married. He is living with his wife of 11 years and he has purchased a house. The place is made of adobe but at least it belongs to him Benito is a baker. He makes bread and he is helped by his family.

Benito needs a loan to buy flour for his business. He hopes you can help him. He works hard and is assisted by his wife

loans.use: to buy flour for his business

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en: Cipriano needs a loan to buy a milking cow because he needs to give some rest to the cows he has. He is a widower and he is in charge of three kids. Cipriano is an experienced man. He was trained by his late father so he knows what he is doing. Besides, he loves his kids a lot so he will work harder.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Nancy María

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 23 y 17 años de edad de los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es chofer y  agricultor.
Nancy es una mujer que no les gusta quedarse cruzada de brazos esperando que su marido solvente todo los gastos sino que con el fruto de su trabajo ayudarlo a solventar los gastos que genera su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, para esto ella tiene un bazar en el centro de la ciudad, en el cual además de artículos de bazar también vende flores naturales y arreglos florares, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 18h00, lleva con su negocio 16 años y le gusta lo que hace ya que en sus arreglos se entretiene y además se gana su sustento diario.
Este crédito lo va  a invertir en comprar bisuterías, chocolates, flores, cosas para regalos entre otros productos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que el que tiene es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, in the neighborhood "30 de Septiembre" in the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the Communal Bank "Plazoleta Elroy Alfaro" meet. This area is known for its delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and are renowned throughout the country.

Nancy lives here. She is 47 years old. She is married and from this relationship has two children who are 23 and 17 years old. They are studying in university and high school respectively. Her husband is a chauffeur and a farmer.

Nancy is a woman who does not like to remain with her arms crossed expecting that her husband will pay all the expenses. With the fruit of her labor, she helps him to pay for the household expenses and the education of their children. To do this, she has a bazaar in the center of the city where, aside from bazaar articles, she also sells natural flowers and floral arrangements. She works every day from 8:30am until 6pm . She has had her business for 16 years and she likes what she does since she has fun doing the arrangements, and besides, she earns her daily sustenance.

This loan will be invested in buying stationary articles, chocolates, flowers, and gift items among other products. Nancy is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes the help that she receives from the group. Her dream is to have her own place of business since the one that she has is rented.

loans.use: to buy stationary items, chocolates, flowers, gift articles etc.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hauwa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Hauwa is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married and is the mother of 4 children, all of whom are going to school She is the owner of her house She makes cheese, which she learned with her mother when she was little She needs a loan to buy a cow because she wants to increase her cheese production and needs more milk.

She will appreciate your help as she works hard and she is healthy

loans.use: to buy a cow for more milk for cheese making

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Two years ago, 32-year-old Maricel successfully started her own business. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells varieties of goods. She has been doing this to help her husband in raising their children. They have five children to support. Their children are 12, 10, 8, 4 and 1-year-old. Maricel's only wish in life is to improve her business for their sustainability everyday. She wants to give the family a better life and enable them to finish their studies.

To do this, she is requesting for a loan to buy commodities that will help her augment her earnings. She needs to purchase items such as biscuits, candies, chips, bread, juice, fruits, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, drinking liquor, and coconut wine.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, chips, bread, juice, fruits, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, drinking liquor, and coconut wine.
