loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Ishaku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ishaku can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ishaku has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Ishaku is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family and children, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Engeline

texts.en:
Engeline is 61 years old and widowed with five children. Engeline works very hard to provide for them.

Engeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices and other snack foods.

Engeline has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Engeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices and other snack foods

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is a mason. He is 37 years old and he lives at his father's house. Celso is a father of two daughters; they are going to school. Celso is divorced.

Celso needs a loan to buy wood he will resell and he will use for his work. Celso loves his daughters a lot and he will give his best to support them. He hopes you can help him, because his ex-wife is currently unemployed.

Celso is in the picture at the place where he lives, and you can see some of the materials he uses to work.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children. 

She has had a tailoring business for 15 years. She will be using the loan to purchase more materials so as to make clothes for her customers.

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more material so as to make clothes for her customers

loans.name: Maxyne

texts.en:
Maxyne is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children.

She has had a retail shop business for 3 years. She will be using the loan to purchase to buy stock of retail goods e.g. cooking fat, flour and soft drinks to sell to his customers and hopes this will help her to support her husband in paying school fees for their children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children well through university.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed KShs 35,000 to be repaid in 12 months

loans.use: to buy stock of retail goods e.g. cooking fat, flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 34 years old and single with two children, one child still in school, Flordeluna works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeluna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Flordeluna has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Flordeluna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles and other snack foods

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 31 years old, married woman. Sumaira is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Sumaira closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, Joshua is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.name: Inés Elizabeth

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es taxista.
Inés es una mujer que se dedica a preparar dulces de muchos sabores y colores los cuales son muy solicitados por personas de todas partes del país ya que son muy típicos del lugar y con un sabor delicioso, ella los vende al publico o al por mayor en un local que tiene en su casa lugar en el cual también vende agua en bidones, actividad que también le deja muy buenos ingresos que les ayudan a salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar ingredientes para preparar los dulces y bidones de agua. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y está muy agradecida por la  ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank "Plazoleta Elroy Alfaro" meet every fifteen days in the "30 de Septiembre" neighborhood in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for its delicious sweets that are made by the locals and are renowned throughout the entire country.

Ines lives in this place. She is 51 years old, married, and from this relationship has 5 children. They are all adults. Two of them still live with her and her husband. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Ines is a woman who works making sweets of many flavors and colors which are very sought after by people in all parts of the country since they are very typical of this area and they have such a delicious taste. She sells them to the public or wholesale in a place of business that she has in her house. From there, she also sells water in containers, an occupation that also gives her good earnings which helps them to move forward.

This loan is to buy ingredients to prepare the sweets and containers of water. Ines has been in the Communal bank for 3 years and she is very grateful for the help that she receives with the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to prepare sweets and containers of water

loans.name: Jibril

texts.en:

Before joining Babban Gona, Jibril would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jibril can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jibril will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Jibril is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en:
Rufo is married and he has been living with his wife for 10 years. Rufo is a baker and he makes bread to sell to many places.

Rufo needs a loan to fix a room at his house because the place needs a lot of work. Rufo hopes you can help him because he is the only support for his family, Rufo has a lot of experience in the bread business so he is ready to ask for a loan. In the picture, you can see where he lives with his wife.

loans.use: to fix a room at his house

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma pays rent and she is the mother of three kids. She is divorced and she is the only support for her family. She also helps her parents and she needs a loan to pay for medical intervention for her father who is very ill and doesn't have good medical insurance.  Norma is working and she hopes you can help her to assist her father.

loans.use: to pay for medical intervention for her father who is ill.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, five and a half times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Samaila can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Samaila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Samaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Usama

texts.en:
Usama is maize farmer from Liman village. As a member of Babban Gona, Usama is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usama would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Usama can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. He is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en:
Istifanus is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, Istifanus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Istifanus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Istifanus can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Istifanus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Istifanus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is married and he has been living for 3 years with his wife at his parents' house because he doesn't have the money to rent or buy his own home.

Ruben makes cheese which he learned to make with his father when he was young. He requires a loan to buy a cow for his business.

Ruben would like to have his own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is divorced and she is the mother of one daughter She works at a hotel, but her payment is not good, so she needs a loan to buy clothes to sell at the Christmas season. Salome is the only support for her family, so she hopes you can help her. If this business goes ok for her, she will buy more clothes next time.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 61 years old and she is married and has four kids. Martha is still managing a grocery store, and she has also started to make curtains and tablecloths. She needs a loan to buy fabrics. She will design new kinds of curtains because of the Christmas season.

Martha has experience in the sewing business; that is why she is convinced she can make extra money if she makes curtains and tablecloths. She is healthy and she hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for over 11 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a better business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en: Hillary is a married man. he describes himself as honest. he operates a food café. he has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. he describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. he will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. he hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Shaline

texts.en:
Shaline is from a family of six. She is married and provides for her husband as he is currently unemployed. Shaline’s source of income is the business of mobile money transfer which she currently operates in Lusaka, Zambia.

Shaline had a tough upbringing which made her determined and hardworking. She loves running her own Zoona because it helps her provide for her family and at the same time serve her community by rendering a service to them. Shaline’s business deals in the sending and receiving of monies. She provides the service and customers come to her kiosk to access financial services.

Shaline has requested her first Kiva loan in order to purchase a trading kiosk so that her location can be more visible. She has also requested the funds to increase her capital so that she can continue to serve people who need to access financial services much faster.

Shaline believes that a Kiva loan will help her improve her business by helping her attract and serve more customers. She enjoys helping people through her mobile money transfer business and would eventually want to expand to other towns around Zambia and beyond. Shaline hopes that Kiva lenders will invest in her business so that she can reach her goals and be an example to upcoming entrepreneurs. She sees this loan as a way forward and thanks the lenders for supporting her and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a trading kiosk and increase the capital float so that she can grow her business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 32 years old and he lives with his wife and two children in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Edgar is a farmer and through his farming works he manages to sustain his nice family’s needs. In his farm Edgar has cows, calves, a bull, sheep, lambs and chickens. With the help of his beautiful wife Edgar sells his farms’ milk, macun (national dairy-product), butter, meat and eggs. Edgar also is master in potato cultivation and he sells his farm’s potato from his farm to re-sellers.

This young farmer dream of a farm bigger and richer as being very laborious he is sure that he will overcome any work in order to earn more profit for his farm and family as well. This loan of 690.000 Armenian drams Edgar asks for the purchase of a cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of a cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Amasimbi Sub Group B

texts.en: Daniel is a group leader, 33 years old. He is married with two children aged between 3 and 8 years. They all attend school. The group is called Amasimbi, which in English means “some precious things." They sell different products on a retail scale and they wish to expand their businesses in order to improve their standards of living. Daniel is a motorcyclist and has been riding a motorcycle taxi business for the past 8 years, while his wife is a tailor. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for repairing his motorcycle. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for repairing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Pervaiz

texts.en:
Pervaiz is a married man, the responsible father of three children, aged 33 and living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He owns a sweets and candies production business and has nearly 15 long years experience. He is capable of convincing the customers with his calm and humble style and sells his customers the sweet kinds they are in search of, for several occasions.

But he is falling short of the raw materials to fill his inventory stock, so that he is able to increase his profits and better sustain the business for his family's future.

Therefore Pervaiz applied for the loan so that he may be successful in attaining what he is dreaming of and ace the target he has set for himself. Pervaiz thanks and pays regards to the Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in his sweets and candies production business.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a resident of Rawalpindi,Pakistan. He is married and father of a child. He was born into a poor household, which forced him to take financial responsibility for his large family from a very early age. However Noor’s lack of education did not discourage him, instead it motivated him to find employment and opportunities to secure his family, So after some experiences he started a electronics store in the area not far of from where he lives.

For seven years Noor invested most of his time and money into his store.The revenue generated from his business was minimal and less profitable for the family needs. So Noor decided to inject a larger capital amount, as he believes that by doing so, the results will be more profitable than usual.

Without the amount Noor’s family conditions couldn’t be changed, so he applied for the loan amount from the Kiva platform through BRAC Pakistan. Noor’s dedication, hard work and commitment towards his business along with the Kivaloan will help him fulfill the needs of the family.

loans.use: to invest in stock for his electrical supplies store.

loans.name: Evria

texts.en: Evria is a business woman.  A loan of $1500.00 is offered to Evria to improve her business. She is taking this loan and she will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as oil, salt, noodles, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, slippers, lighters, scissors, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things. She has been involving in business activities since 2010 and she started with her own working capital of $ 600.00. She feels so comfortable running her business because it has become her activity. Running a business has made Evria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, noodles, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, slippers, lighters, scissors, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, and  hard drinks.

loans.name: Rilwanu

texts.en:
Rilwanu is a maize farmer from Shararriya village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rilwanu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rilwanu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rilwanu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rilwanu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Russel Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is married and she lives with her husband and her two kids She is working selling cleaning stuff and electrical appliances. Since Christmas is coming she needs a loan to buy merchandise She is still working at a cleaning company. She is ready to work harder, and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works at a hotel and is the mother of one daughter. Ester moved recently, and she needs a loan to buy new furniture for her house because her old sofa and couches were damaged and were too old.

Ester hopes you can help her because she is at her work for a lot of time, so she is in the union and has benefits. Besides, she wants to give a better life to her daughter.

She is shown at her work in the picture.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her house.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has two children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business selling cosmetics, which she has been doing for five years. She also operates a M-pesa business (mobile payments business) within the shop. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. 

Halima requested her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer from Lado village. As a Babban Gona member, Shehu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Shehu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Shehu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Shehu hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Edem est un homme marié âgé de 54 ans résidant à Baguida. Père de sept enfants, Edem est un revendeur de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Edem désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de lait et de paquets de bonbons. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Edem compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Edem is a 54 years old married men living in Baguida. Father of seven children, Edem sells general food products, which he procures once a month from the market and resells under a shed in front of his home. Edem is seeking this loan to order milk cartons and packs of candy. Good sales will yield a profit that Edem will use to make better sales, contribute to his family's growth and children's education.

loans.use: to buy 20 milk cartons and 22 packs of candy

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Iliya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Iliya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres, está en su primer ciclo del programa comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas esperanzas de poder crecer y salir adelante y por medio de sus esfuerzos procurarse una mejor calidad de vida.
Adelina es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas variadas de productos de primera necesidad, comenta que ya tiene una clientela formada que siempre les hace muchos pedidos, ella con la ayuda de su grupo quiere poder crecer y mejorar su emprendimiento.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos de primera necesidad para la venta, como ser jabones, suavizantes, azúcar, carne y otros.
texts.en:
The women's committee is on its first cycle of the women's committee program. It's a new group that has high hopes to be able to grow and get ahead and, through their efforts, be able to provide a better quality of life for themselves.

Adelina is one of the members of the group. She makes a living selling various essential products. She points out she already has a set customer base who is always placing many orders. With the help of her group she wants to be able to grow and improve her venture.

She requests this loan to be able to buy essential supplies to sell, such as soaps, softeners, sugar, meat and other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as: soaps, softeners, sugar, meat and other things.

loans.name: Tanya Katherine

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Tanya, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de año y medio de edad. El marido es empleado privado. 
Tanya con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar desde hace casi 2  años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días.  Gracias a sus ganancias ha podido solventar muchos  gastos mucho mas desde que llego su bebé la cual además de cuidados necesita de muchas cosas, por eso lucha ella día a día para que a ella no le falte lo necesario.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva dos ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos aprovecha para comprar más prendas. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of Grupo De Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro [Eloy Alfaro Park Communal Bank] meet every two weeks in the September 30 neighborhood in Rocafuerte Canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by locals and known throughout the country.

Tanya lives in this place, is 20 years old, and is in a common law marriage from which she has a one-and-a-half year child. Her spouse is a private employee. With the intention of earning money on her own with which to help her spouse with the household expenses, Tanya began making a living two years ago in catalog clothing sales. Her sales method is door-to-door. She goes out in her free time and also sells from her home where her well known customers come. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. 

Thanks to her earnings, she could cover much more of many expenses since the arrival of her baby, who, in addition to being cared for, needs many things. For this she struggles day after day so that she won't lack for any necessity.

This loan is going to be used to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. She has gone through two cycles in the Credit Group and she likes it because she can make use of the loans to buy more garments. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer from Agalawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Bala is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Bala can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Bala is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nafsin

texts.en:
Nafsin is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Nafsin is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Nafsin would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Nafsin can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Nafsin has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Nafsin is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a maize farmer from Gabas village. As a Babban Gona member, Hamisu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Hamisu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hamisu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hamisu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is maize farmer from Nabai village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 57 years old. She is a hairdresser and she sells beauty products.

Juana requires a loan to buy more beauty products. She would like to have her own beauty parlor in the future.

Juana hopes you can help her since she likes her job and has the experience to make good sales. Moreover, she is always looking for new customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mónica Vanessa

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Mónica tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y  tienen  un hijo de 8 mese de nacido. Su esposo es técnico en computadoras.
Mónica es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para ganarse algo por su cuenta y así contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar y la crianza de su pequeño, para esto ella como muchas personas opto por dedicarse a un actividad que le permita ganar algo sin descuidar a su bebé y su hogar, ella vende zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta¡ es puerta a puerta ella sale tres o cuatro veces por semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, ella lleva más de 3 años en este negocio con el cual se gana sus recursos que le ayudan a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatillas y zapatos ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar.  Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro loan group meet every 15 days in the 30 de Septiembre neighborhood in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets, prepared by the locals, that are known throughout the entire country. This is where Mónica, age 28, lives. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has an eight month old son. Her husband is a computer technician.

Mónica is a very hard-working woman who does what is needed to earn something on her own. This way she contributes to the household expenses and to raising her little one. In order to do this she, like many people, opted to work at a business activity that allows her to earn something without neglecting her baby and her home.

She sells shoes buy catalog. Her way of selling is door to door. She goes out three or four times a week to offer her products, which she leaves on credit. She collects every eight days. She has been engaged in this business activity for over three years. Through her business she earns resources that help them to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy slippers and shoes because she has several orders to deliver. She has been in the loan group for two years. She likes it because of the help that the loans provide.

Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres al Mando se formó en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, las integrantes a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y con las capacitaciones quieren ir mejorando y creciendo.
La Sra. Patricia es la Tesorera del grupo ella se desempeña como costurera ella se describe como una mujer luchadora y capaz para poder salir adelante y necesita el crédito para poder abrir su propio taller de costura, y de esa forma poder ir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Agradece por esta oportunidad inmensa que esta recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
This group, named Mujeres al Mando, was founded in the city of Villa Elisa. The members want to improve and grow through their effort, their skills, and by working continuously.

Ms. Patricia is the group’s treasurer. She works as a seamstress and describes herself as a go-getter who has what it takes to get ahead. She needs the loan to be able to open her own sewing workshop. This way she can work towards improving the living conditions of herself and her loved ones.

She’s thankful for this immense opportunity that she’s getting to grow!

loans.use: to set up a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a 38-year-old mother of five children whom she takes care of. She resides in the outskirts of the city. She runs a retail shop in the market where she sells various goods, ranging from food stuffs to home products.

She is a second-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) and she successfully repaid her previous loan of 500,000 UGX. She is back again for a new loan of 1,000,000 UGX which she will use to boost her business by purchasing more produce. She appreciates the support rendered to her and other clients that has improved their standards of living.

loans.use: to boost her retail trade by buying more produce.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdullahi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abdullahi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Abdullahi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education..

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Yunusa

texts.en:
Alhaji Yunusa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Yunusa is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Alhaji Yunusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Yunusa will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Yunusa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Saratu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saratu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Saratu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer from Dogon Juri village. As a Babban Gona member, Sani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Sani can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sani no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sani hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en: Florencio is a mason. He is married and he has kids. He is living at the house that belongs to his older son.  He needs a loan to buy his business so that he will make more money and he will have his own construction company.  He works hard. He is experienced and he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old and married with two daughters. She is the owner of her house Martha and her husband are farmers and they also sell meat at the market. They pay rent for the place where they sell meat.

Martha needs a loan to buy cattle so she can make more money.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Aura Leonor

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Bendición De Dios  se reúne cada quince días en Los Arenales de  la parroquia Crucita en el cantón Portoviejo, lugar conocido por sus hermosas playas que rodean el lugar el cual es muy visitado en toda época del año por los turistas nacionales o extranjeros, además por su variedad culinaria la cual es muy apreciada por los visitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Aura tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad, uno de ellos viven con ella.
Aura es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría pollos,  ella en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos o tres meses y luego los vende a  comerciantes o  por libras por su casa, ella también como muchas personas de la localidad se dedican a la venta de pinchaguas (pescado), todos los días va a las playas de la localidad a comprar estos peces muy comunes en la zona, luego los limpia en su casa y curte con limón para luego venderlos por tarrinas al publico que gustan de este delicioso producto. 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos, medicinas y pescado.  Tiene seis años en el Grupo De Crédito y está muy agradecida ya que con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños es gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The Bendición De Dios loan group meets every 15 days in Los Arenales in the Crucita parrish, Portoviejo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that surround the city, which is frequently visited during all times of the year by national and foreign tourists. It is also known for its culinary variety, which is greatly appreciated by the visitors.

Aura, age 53, lives in this place. She is a single mother with four children, who are now grown. One of them lives with her. Aura is a woman who has had to work hard in order to get ahead. She has a small farm where she raises chickens. At times she buys a lot of chickens to raise for two or three months. Then she sells them to merchants or by the pound at her house. Like many people in the area, she also sells 'pinchaguas' [fish]. Every day she goes to the beaches in the area to buy these fish that are very common to the area. She then cleans them at her house, and she treats them with lime. She later sells them in tubs; the public likes this delicious product.

She will use the new loan to buy chickens, feed, medicine, and fish. She has been in the loan group for six years. She is very grateful because she gets ahead with the loans.

Her dream is to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, medicine, and fish.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salisu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Salisu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.
