loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ouwyece Group

texts.fr:
Madou  Il est celui qui a la corde du bœuf en main c’est un éleveur de bœuf. Âgé de 42 ans, il est malien  et père 08 enfants dont quatre(4)  fréquentent l’école.
Sa femme est commerçante et éleveuse de moutons et chèvres.
Client  fidèle et crédible du RMCR,Madou exerce l’élevage il y a 7 ans de cela, il vend ses bœufs  au marché non loin de sa localité. 
Il a emprunté 300 000FCFA pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour son activité d’élevage. Il maitrise bien son activité raison pour laquelle le RMCR lui fait confiance. Dans l’avenir il veut avoir un troupeau de bœufs pour ses enfants enfin qu’ils aient un avenir meilleur
texts.en:
Madou, the man with the steer's rope in his hand, is a cattle raiser. Aged 42, he comes from Mali and is the father of eight children, of whom four attend school. His wife is a small-scale retailer and raises sheep and goats.

A faithful and trustworthy client of RMCR, Madou has been involved in cattle-raising for seven years. He sells his steers at a market not far from his locality. He borrowed 300,000 FCFA to grow his sales for his livestock raising. He is knowledgeable in his business and that is a reason why RMCR has confidence in him.

In future, Madou would like to have a herd of cattle for his children so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to raise cattle for sale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is 33 years old. He is single and he has no children.  He lives with his brother and he helps him with the expenses.  Edwin is a farmer and he sells vegetables. He goes to many fairs to offer his products. He needs a loan to buy seeds for his business.  In that way, he will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn needs a loan to purchase meat (beef, chicken, and pork) for her business. As you know, she is divorced. She is taking care of two kids and she is living with her parents but she helps them with the expenses. Evelyn will be helped by her children during Christmas so she hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to purchase meat (beef, chicken, and pork).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 44 years old. She lives with her parents and she helps them a lot. She is a doctor and also a teacher at a college.

Lilian needs a loan to pay for an update class in medicine. In that way, she will be more qualified and she will get better chances in her field.

She works hard and she hopes you can support her.

loans.use: to pay for an update class in medicine.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 55 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Beatrice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Bungoma District, Kenya.

Beatrice started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Beatrice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season			.

loans.name: Hyacinth

texts.en:
Hyacinth is 54 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still in school, Hyacinth works very hard to provide for them.

Hyacinth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods and other personal care products.

Hyacinth has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Hyacinth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Agape 2 Group

texts.en:
The Agape 2 Group of 6 members, with a strong bond of love for the field of business, wishes to thank Kiva lenders for the compassionate help they offer to their small-scale businesses.

Faustina, 33, makes her living from traveling sales of toothpaste and toothbrushes of all kinds. She has been doing this for about 2 years.

Faustina is a single parent of 2 children who are in school. She is a very selfless woman who exerts herself daily to both get by as well as help her loved ones. She is asking for her loan portion so she can invest in a variety of toothpastes to continue with her sales. This is her 3rd loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Faustina says 'I will be very grateful if my request is granted by your kindness.'

The entire group promises to hold each other responsible for the repayment of their group loan.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan makes clothes for children, such as coats and vests. He is living at his mother house and he helps her with the expenses. Ivan needs a loan to buy fabric for his business.

He would like to get married and to live at his own place in the future. He hopes you can help him because he works hard and he will put a workshop in another place soon

loans.use: to buy fabrics for his tailoring business

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Mrs Thắm is 32 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling beverage for 6 years.Thắm lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2014, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thắm has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mertina's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mertina, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 53 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 13 farmers in Bungoma District, Kenya. She is married and has 4 children.

Mertina is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, and this means that she is able to have access to quality training as well as acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place.

Mertina says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to consistently feed her family, significantly improving her day-to-day life. Mertina will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights, with this loan the group will acquire a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Baby Lyn

texts.en:
Baby Lyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Baby Lyn is 31 years old and has one child still in school.

Baby Lyn has a food processing business in the Philippines. Baby Lyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Baby Lyn has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 40 years old and has three children.  Ilyn is married and has three children are presently in school.

Ilyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ilyn requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ilyn has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and has one child.  Helen is married and has one child still in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha has been involved in activities since 2013. She started her business with her own working capital of $ 800.00. Joaninha has a shop in her business. So she is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she want to buy additional supplies according to people like, including shampoo, catsup, toothpaste, soap, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, candles, milk, sardines, incluiding soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she can build her business so big in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, catsup, toothpaste, soap, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, milk, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rita se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer su situación de vida y la de sus seres queridos, y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eulalia quien tiene una Despensa y también vende ropas usadas en su casa, y esto le genera ingresos para ella y su familia. Su esposo también trabaja, por lo que ambos se ayudan para poder sacar adelante a la familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, sacrificada que quiere seguir creciendo para ayudar a sus seres queridos. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos de todo tipo para poder surtir su despensa, y también para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en: The group called Santa Rita was formed in the city of Encarnacion. They are within the program of poverty elimination which will allow them to be able to find out about their life condition and that of their loved ones, and according to it, to work hard to help their families. One of the members is Eulalia who has a small grocery store, and who also sells second hand clothes in her house. This generates income for her and her family. Her husband also works, so both help each other to move their family forward. She is a very hardworking and self-sacrificing person, who wants to continue growing to help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy inputs of all types in order to stock up her grocery store, and also to buy diverse clothing items to sell, so she can continue with her business, working hard to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy diverse inputs for the grocery store and various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Las Inversionistas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Inversionistas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo con muchas esperanzas de crecer, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olinda, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender por su barrio, es una muy buena en lo que hace, y gracias a eso ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser: carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group called "Las Inversionistas" is in its first cycle of the program of the women's committee. It is a new group with many hopes of growing. They are doing a poll on poverty elimination in order to improve their life condition. One of the members is Olinda, who works selling meals that she prepares herself, and that she later goes to sell around her neighborhood. She is very good in what she does, and thanks to this she already has many customers. She is requesting this loan to buy inputs to prepare her meals, such as: meat, spices, vegetables, bread items, and other things; and in this way, to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy inputs to prepare meals, such as: meat, spices, vegetables, bread items and other things.

loans.name: Fernando Pascual

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Bendición De Dios se reúne cada quince días en Los Arenales de  la parroquia Crucita en el Cantón Portoviejo, lugar conocido por sus hermosas playas que rodean el lugar el cual es muy visitado en toda época del año por los turistas ya se nacionales o extranjeros, además por su variedad culinaria la cual es muy apreciada por los visitantes.
En este lugar vive don Fernando, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de una hermana.
Fernando es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida a punta de esfuerzo, el es albañil y  trabaja por contratos de personas particulares, el trabaja con  sus propios materiales como tablas de madera cañas, etc.  Él es muy cumplido realizando una buena labor y en el tiempo adecuado.
Este crédito es para comprar herramientas, madera, cañas guadua y otros materiales de construcción. Lleva 3 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es seguir adelante contando con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Bendicion De Dios" meets every fifteen days in Los Arenales, in the parish of Crucita, in the canton of Portoviejo. It is a place known for the beautiful beaches that surround it. It is visited every season of the year by national and international tourists. It is also popular for its varied cuisine which is much appreciated by the visitors.

It is the place where Fernando lives. He is 45 years old, single and lives in his sister's house.

Fernando is a very hard-working man who always has enjoyed earning a living through his own efforts. He is a construction worker who works by contract from individual people. He works with his own materials such as wooden boards, bamboo etc. He is very accomplished at carrying out good work in an appropriate amount of time.

This loan is to buy tools, wood, giant bamboo and other construction materials. He has had 3 cycles in the Communal Bank and he likes it because the loans are very helpful. His dream is to continue moving forward with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy tools, wood, giant bamboo and other construction materials

loans.name: Hoy Group

texts.en:
Hoy is a 34-year-old married rice farmer with two children in his care. He lives in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. His two children attend school. He is pictured first from the right and has cultivated rice since 2001. His wife is 31 years old, and is a rice farmer as well. Together, they can make about $3 daily.

Hoy is a group leader. He would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members. He will use his portion to buy a rice-milling machine for farming. This loan will help him generate other income for the family. After buying the machine, he is going to expand his farming and help his children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a rice-milling machine for farming.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old, and has one child still in school.

Jonalyn has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 37 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Bungoma District, Kenya.

Christine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Christine also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Christine's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation						.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is a driver. He lives with his uncle and he is a divorced man. He has a daughter and she is going to school. Juan needs a loan to fix his car. Juan is the only support for his daughter. He works a lot of hours so he hopes you can help him. Juan doesn't live with his daughter but he will do anything to be able to do that soon

loans.use: to fix his car

loans.name: Las Franciscanas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Franciscanas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bernardina quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, y para poder cumplir con ellos pide este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Franciscanas" ("The Franciscans") is in its third loan cycle with the Women's Committee program. They're all taking part in a poverty elimination program, striving to improve living conditions for themselves and their loved ones.
One of the members is Bernardina, who sells foodstuffs that she prepares herself. She's a person who works hard to improve her and her loved ones' living conditions. She has a very good clientele that always places several orders, and in order to meet these orders she's requesting this loan. She wishes to purchase supplies for making her food, such as greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, etc. She gives thanks for this opportunity to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make food, such as greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 30 years old, married, and lives at Solana with her family. She has two young children. In order to acquire income, she cooks foods for snacks and sells them using a small food cart. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to invest in her food-selling business. She will buy flour, lard, eggs, juice and biscuits to sell. She hopes to continue selling snacks to the people in her village. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, eggs, juice and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support four children. She is married and has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Marilou is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Sharon requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Sharon is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 61 years old and is married with 6 children, one of whom is in school. She lives in Battambang province where she and her husband grow rice and vegetables to earn their main source of income. They have been involved in farming for years. Together, they earn about 12 USD per day, and they manage to save about 8 USD each day. The main challenge to their farming business is drought.

This will be the fifth loan cycle for her with VisionFund, and the past loans have enabled her to earn a better living. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to support their farming business with the purchase of organic fertilizer and payment of harvesting fees.

Sok hopes that this loan will not only enable her to earn more yields to improve her living, but also help people in her community by hiring them to work on her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pay for harvesting fees.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 50,000. She used this to buy 10 boxes of laundry powder, 10 boxes of laundry bars, 10 boxes of shampoo, and 10 boxes of fabric conditioner, which she sold at retail and also by distribution.

Pamela's number products is growing. She now also supplies clothes bleach direct from the manufacturer, which she gets at 30% off the price, as well as her other home products. Pamela is now the sole distributor of home products in her area, and she supplies the marketplace and a large store. Also, her mobile money transfer is gaining regular customers. All of this is because of the additional loan.

Pamela's income revenue was used to help her relatives in the province, especially her old aunt and her nephew's maintenance treatment.

Pamela is requesting another loan in the amount of PHP 100,000 to buy more boxes of laundry powder, soap, and clothes bleach, as well as additional capital for her mobile money transfer.

Pamela wants to maintain her growing business to continuously provide for her family and for her community.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of laundry powder, soap, clothes bleach and additional capital for her mobile money transfer.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Miguel está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una de las integrantes espera poder mejorar y crecer con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de sus programas.
La Sra. Virginia es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder brindar una vida digna a su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por sus seres queridos, para poder ayudarles en todo lo que está en sus posibilidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser: tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group called San Miguel is in its 1st cycle of the Women's Committee Program.  Each of the group's members hopes to improve and grow with the help of Fundación Paraguaya and its programs.  

Virginia is one of the Group's members, she makes a living as a hairdresser.  Through her work Virginia has the means to provide her family with a decent life.  She is a hard working woman that strives to be able to help her loved ones in any way that she can.  

Virginia is requesting this loan in order to purchase supplies for her beauty salon such as:  hair color, creams, shampoos, conditioners, etc. in order to be able to continue with her work in the same manner that she has done so far.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she gets to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her beauty salon such as: hair color, creams, shampoos, conditioners, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia needs a loan to buy cleaning products. She has a little store where she sells these products. She is married and she is the mother of four kids. She also has a passion for music. She sings with a tropical band.  She hopes you can help her because she works hard. She is healthy.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Las Mercedes 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado lleva por nombre Las Mercedes 2, están en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de los que le ofrece la fundación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Del Rosaria, quien se dedica a la venta de jugos y ensaladas de frutas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder ir capacitándose y mejorar. Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas y de estación, de manera a poder hacer sus jugos y también hacer ensaladas de frutas para vender.
Ella está contenta por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en: The group called Las Mercedes 2 is in the program of poverty elimination, working hard to improve their life condition through what is offered by the foundation. One of its members is Del Rosaria who works selling juices and fruit salads. She is a very hardworking person who gives all of herself to continue getting trained and improving herself. She is requesting this loan to buy seasonal fresh fruits in order to make her juices, and also to prepare fruit salads to sell. She is happy for the opportunity she receives to be able to grow and move forward.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fresh fruits to make juices and fruit salads.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin has had an affinity for nice cars ever since he was a little kid. The idea to start his business occurred to Justin when he noticed that national car rental agencies implemented luxury vehicles into their fleets. After some research, Justin realized that there were not many companies in his area that offered luxury car rental options to clients. That's when the idea to start his luxury car rental business was born.

Justin currently lives with his younger siblings and runs his business with two additional partners. The greatest success his business has had so far has been being able to maintain an equipment line of credit for his business vehicles. Despite this success, Justin's business has struggled in obtaining the proper insurance because his company is fairly new.

Currently, Justin is seeking a loan to access working capital for his business. His goal is to transition all vehicles into an equipment credit line and expand his car selection into a larger fleet.

loans.use: to access working capital for his car rental business.

loans.name: Thimotius

texts.en:
Thimotius is a 49-year-old widower and lives with four children, who are between 6 and 12 years old. They are enrolled in the elementary school. Thimothius has been involved in this business for a year at his home. He sells some daily needs as demanded by the neighbors, such as cooking oil, instant noodles, soap, detergent, shampoo, snacks, etc.

He has planned to place the business next to his house but he needs more money to make it happen. A neighbor informed about the TLM group loan. He is allowed to join the group as an additional member in the existing group called Sejahtera Group.

He then requested a loan of IDR 2,000,000 from TLM. He also got information that Kiva was also involved in supporting him with the loan capital. He would like to spend the loan on the materials to build a simple permanent kiosk building, such as sand, cement, zinc, wood, and plywood. He would also use the loan to restock the kiosk stocks. He hopes the loan from Kiva - TLM will enable him to do his best to improve his business in the future as well as to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase the materials to build a semi permanent kiosk, such as sand, cement, roofing, and wood. The loan will also help him restock the kiosk.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is 27 years old and lives in a remote village of Rolea Bier District, Kampong Chhnang Province. La is a teacher and his wife is a farmer. They help each other in their task in order to put the family in better living conditions. He has been engaged in this job nearly five years. Both of them can earn on average USD 5 per day.

At the moment, La would like to buy solar panels to install at his home. This solar will help him and his family with light at night. They also can use the radio or TV for their entertainment or charge their phone. Due to the shortage of funds, La has requested a loan from Kiva to buy a solar home system. He is very happy and thankful to all lenders and also awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Nhor is 51 years old and works very hard at her workplace as a factory worker of Srei Santhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer. With her husband, the daily profit for her house is USD 10 a day. So far, Nhor has been a factory worker for about 10 years.

Currently, Nhor would like to request her first loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike to ride to her workplace. She thanks lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris is 25 years old and married with two children.

Chris works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Chris has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Chris aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Frilyn

texts.en:
Frilyn works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Frilyn requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF in order to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water. Frilyn is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 43 years old and married with five children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Susan has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Susan aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 34 years old and has five children. Wilma is married and has three children who are still in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sarci

texts.en:
Sarci is a 46-year-old woman who is married to Yulius, a 50-year-old carpenter. They are blessed with three children between the ages of 18 and 26. Two of their children work, and one is still enrolled in senior high school.

Because Yulius' income is not enough for their daily living expenses, Sarci decided to start a business selling vegetables in the market. She has been involved in this for five years. She now plans to provide more kinds of vegetables such as water spinach, cabbage, tomato, etc., but this requires more money. She wants to boost her business.

When a neighbor shared information about the loan product provided by TLM, she was interested and applied for a loan of IDR 2,500,000 from TLM. Kiva supports TLM in offering loans for small entrepreneurs like her. She believes the loan provided by Kiva and TLM will encourage her to improve the business and enable her to provide a proper education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of vegetables such as water spinach, cabbage, tomato, etc.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 39 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora tiene su local de Gomería, hace mas de 20 años, con mucha experiencia en el ramo.
La esposa del Sr. Blas se dedica a la venta de ropas, y por medio de sus trabajos ambos ayudan a su familia para darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para poder surtir el negocio de su esposa. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante y ayudar a su esposa.
texts.en:
Blas is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is 39 years old and is a very hard-working and enterprising person. He has had a tire repair shop for more than 20 years and has lots of experience in the field.

Blas's wife works selling clothing and through their work they both help their family providing them with a higher quality of living.

Blas is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of clothing to stock his wife's business. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving to be able to grow, get ahead and to help his wife

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está casado, y comenta que desde muy temprana edad y por la falta de oportunidad de trabajo por la zona, empezó a dedicarse a las ventas ambulantes.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora que poco a poco está creciendo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo.
El pide este préstamo para la compra de productos variados como: calzados deportivos, remeras, jeans, y otros productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Celso is from the city of Carapeguá. He is married, and he reports that he started selling merchandise as a mobile vendor at a very young age, due to the lack of job opportunities in his area.

He is a very hard-working person who is expanding his business little by little so that he can help his family through his work and effort.

He is requesting this loan to buy a variety of products to sell, such as athletic shoes, t-shirts, jeans and other items.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes, t-shirts, jeans and other items to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, un grupo nuevo donde cada una de las que lo integran pone su mayor esfuerzo para mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana quien se dedica a la Venta de Ropas, comenta que por medio de sus ventas puede mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella se destaca dentro del grupo por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo, quiere comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones, y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is a new group, and all of its members are putting forth their best efforts to improve their lives.

One of the members is Ana, who works selling clothing. She reports that through her sales she is able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She stands out within the group for being a very hard-working woman who gives her all so that she can grow and get ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy assorted garments of all types. In this way she will be able to continue growing as she has been doing. She wants to buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants, and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her situation in life.

loans.use: to buy various garments to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and others.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
Yane is a 43-year-old single woman. She has a kiosk business. She lives with her parents, as her siblings work and live at other places. She spends her days at her kiosk business. It is situated at home so she has time with her parents. She sells daily needs such as soap, sugar, tea, coffee, etc.

She plans to provides other products at her business such as cooking oil, flour, rice powder, etc. Therefore, she needs more money to do so. She was excited when a neighbor informed her about TLM group loan product. She thought this would be a good chance for her to improve her business. She then requested a loan of IDR 1,750,000 from TLM. She is sure the loan will make a good impact for further business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cooking oil, flour, rice powder, etc.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 45 years old, married, and has three children. They live in Solana. He is a farmer, and his spouse raises hogs. Ruben is planting and harvesting rice to sell. He also pays laborers who help him with the farming activities such as sowing and plowing the rice field. Ruben needs PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides to use in farming.

Ruben wants to continue improving his crop production so he can achieve a profitable harvest and save for his family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides to use in farming.

loans.name: Naseem Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 57-year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. In the photo above, Naseem is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Uzma is the lady on the left, and Khalida is the lady on the right.

Naseem's daughter is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. She has been running her embroidery business for 11 years in order to cover the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations her business has increased. She is a brave girl.

Naseem’s daughter wants to buy embroidery raw materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbon, needles, and an embroidery machine from the market. Naseem handles her transactions with the customers. Her daughter has become an expert in the embroidery business. So, Naseem has requested a loan so her daughter will be able to buy the needed materials from the market.

Naseem's daughter wants to be able to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not yet have the sufficient cash on hand.

Naseem and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them fund this loan to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her daughter.

loans.name: Alh. Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is a maize farmer from Bakutaje village. As a Babban Gona member, Muhammed is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Muhammed can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Muhammed no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Muhammed hopes to realize better yields. He plans to use his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en: Samath’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Samath makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as teacher and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en: Kimsan’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Kimsan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Las Unidas, ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo y por la fundación paraguaya, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Clara, que con mucho esfuerzo a logrado aumentar los productos que ofrece en su despensa, poco a poco ha ido mejorando, comenta que por medio de su despensa tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos. Clara es una persona que se destaca en este grupo por muy sacrificada y luchadora, y siempre se esfuerza por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Clara pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas variadas y otros, de manera a seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group is called Las Unidas. They actively participate in the activities proposed by the group and by Fundación Paraguaya. They mutually support each other in order to reach the group's common goals.

One of the members is Mrs. Clara, who with much effort has managed to increase the products that she offers in her grocery store. Little by little it's been improving. She says that, because of the grocery store, she has the means to be able to support her family and other loved ones.

Clara is a person who stands out in the group as very self-sacrificing and determined. She always makes an effort to improve her life.

Mrs. Clara is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as vegetables, fruits, meats, various drinks, and other things, in order to continue offering a good variety of products to her clients. She is thankful for getting the opportunity to be able to continue improving her life through her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a grocery store, such as vegetables, fruits, meats, various drinks, and other things.

loans.name: Eleno

texts.es:
Eleno es un joven muy trabajador que con su esfuerzo esta tratando de salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos, tiene 23 años y se gana la vida de una manera digna por medio de sus ventas, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar productos para poder vender.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas y de esa forma poder con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eleno is a very hard-working young man who is trying to get ahead through his efforts and help his loved ones. He is 23 years old, and he makes a living in an upstanding way through his sales. He reports that he used the funds from the previous loan to buy products that he could sell.

He is requesting this new loan in order to buy bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths and sheets, so that he can continue with his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, blankets, tablecloths and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Sirila

texts.es:
La Sra. Sirila es de la Ciudad de Lambaré, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene un taller de confecciones.
Tiene experiencia y antigüedad en el rubro, ella es muy responsable y luchadora y comenta que por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Sirila is from the city of Lambaré, and she is a very hard-working and enterprising person. She has a tailoring workshop.

She has experience and seniority in this field and is very responsible and determined. She comments that through her sales she obtains the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, elastic bands and other supplies so she can continue to make clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic bands and other supplies to use in making clothing.

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josita is 49 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Josita has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Josita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Josita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 63-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judith has a fishing business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy new fish nets and materials for her boat repair.

Judith has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets and materials for her boat repair

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her child. She is married and has a business, direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 2,200 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family, without any diseases caused by contaminated water.

Cristina is aware that, by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Jumdaya

texts.en:
Jumdaya is 47 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are still in school. Jumdaya works very hard to provide for them.

Jumdaya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Jumdaya has been in this business for six years.

In the future Jumdaya would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, flour and other materials for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, flour and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Letecia is 66 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Letecia has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional kilos of meat to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of meat to sell

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 30,000, which she used to repair two washing machines and dryers for business.

Priscilla's laundry shop is doing well. She was able to pay her loan on time as well as increase her income. The revenue from her income was used to pay her children's school expenses for the semester and pay for two of her employee's children's school items and projects.

Today Priscilla is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy laundry soaps, detergents, fabric softeners, and additional irons, as well as to expand her business to buy piglets to start a piggery.

Priscilla's goal of giving the best service is now realized. Priscilla is determined to work hard to see her children finish their schooling as well as helping her employees to have a better life for their families.

loans.use: To buy laundry soaps, detergents, fabric softeners, and additional irons, as well as to expand her business to buy piglets to start a piggery.
